We would recommend Eco Hale without hesitation and would really love to stay again (for longer next time!) if we are ever fortunate enough to come back to the Big Island.

Aloha!  I wanted to let you all know how wonderful it was to stay at Eco Hale with Kaeo and Karl!  This was a wonderful little cabin tucked back in a quite corner of the beautiful island; Kaeo and Karl have outfitted the place with everything one would need for a comfortable stay.  We were so pleased with the little touches; a cooler with ice for a beach day, flippers and snorkels, coffee, fresh fruit, pots and pans to cook......Even though we landed in the Hilo area during an EXTREMELY rainy spell, Eco Hale was warm and cozy.  Thank you so much for this wonderful little home away from home!

This is a very unique, special place to stay. My husband and I were blown away by all of the fun little details that set this place apart from the others. The kitchen area was well stocked and there was a binder full of interesting information and recommendations. The bathroom is adjacent to the kitchen/bedroom space and is gorgeous. There was great hot water and water pressure in the shower. The location feels off the beaten path and remote but the directions to it are detailed and it’s easy to find. The rainforest setting is peaceful and private. Communication with Kaeo and Karl was relaxed and friendly. No complaints - we’d stay at the Eco Hale again in a heartbeat!

The best place of our trip !! Everything is perfect here, the Eco Hale is a peacefull little place in the beauiful garden of Kaeo and Karl, you have everything you need and you enjoy the sound and the smell of the forest !!!
Kaeo and Karl are the nicest people in the world, they really take care of you. We thank us for their kindness and for sharing with us their paradise.

Cozy cabin nestled in what feels like your own personal rain forest!  Centrally located for our hikes to the national park, the tide pools in Paola and dining in Hilo.  Neat, clean, orderly with a fun outdoor cooking area.  Kaeo and Karl are gracious and delightful hosts.  You can't go wrong with this beautiful cabin.

Eco Hale is simply perfect: clean, cool, comfortable and loved. The attention to detail in the design of the space and all the equipment provided is remarkable. Seriously, I had absolutely everything I needed -- including things above and beyond like coffee, papaya, avocado, filtered water and chocolate. And there seems to be an invisible orchid fairy wandering around in the jungle who delivers fragrant and fresh-picked flowers every time you turn around for more than a second. 

Eco Hale is at a perfect location if you want to explore. Very easy access Volcano National Park. (I even hiked to see the lava from a point nearby -- amazing!). I also visited the hot ponds, the Portlandia-like little town of Pahoa, took yoga classes in Hilo, jaunted down to Kalani retreat center, saw the glowing crater late at night under a starlit sky, the Black Sand Beach, the Green Sand Beach and more... 

I thought about asking Kaeo and Karl if they would adopt me forever and ever, but all good things must come to an end. Don't worry about the rain, or the fact that you cannot walk to a white sand beach, or the lack of bars serving up Mai Thai in the immediate vicinity. None of these things are an obstacle. Come see what this luxurious little jungle cabin has in store for you.

This place is such a gem. My husband and I stayed here for our 2 year anniversary, we live in a noisy city and coming here, being able to fall asleep listening to crickets and frog was amazing. The bathroom is adorable and I loved taking showers, being able to see out of the floor to ceiling window into the rainforest. Having breakfast on the outdoor breakfast bar and coming home to random fruits placed there by our hosts was the best surprise. Kaeo and Karl are great hosts. Thank you so much for making our vacation even better. Love this place!

Ci aspettavamo una casa nella tranquillità della foresta e abbiamo trovato un piccolo gioiello in un posto dove entrare in pieno contatto con la meravigliosa natura dell'isola. Il giardino è splendido e i due padroni di casa ci hanno accolto e ospitato con un calore davvero speciale. Non potevamo trovare un posto migliore da dove iniziare l'esplorazione di un isola fantastica come Big Island

ideal stay for us. The place is in the middle of Volcano/Hilo/Puna, it was convenient for us to explore those areas. Kaeo was very gracious and the unit had all the necessary things for staying/outing. I would stay at her place again and again. Thank you much.

My wife Jenny and I had a lovely stay at Eco Hale. If you are looking for somewhere off the beaten path, this is the place for you. At night, it seems as if you are staying in the middle of a jungle rainforest (though with surprisingly few pests; in fact, I didn't even notice mosquitoes at night). The cottage was clean and smartly outfitted; the owners included everything you might want for your Big Island adventures (snorkel equipment, beach chairs and towels, ponchos and umbrellas, etc.); Kaeo and Karl were even nice enough to leave us fresh fruit, banana bread, and other treats. I would definitely recommend Eco Hale for travelers eager to escape the resort scene and glimpse a bit of life in inland Hawaii. That said, it's barely a 25 minute drive (if that) to the Volcano Park or Hilo, so you are never that far from major tourist destinations.

We really loved our little house in the jungle. Having breakfast on the veranda was great and we even got a lot of fruits and other food from our hosts. Kaeo and Karl gave us a very warm welcome and directly made us feel at home.

Excellent choice! Everything was perfect, very clean, quiet, unique accomodation. Ideal for visiting the volcano area. Host are more than friendly. When we arrive we had fruit, chocolates, bread...and even a bottle of wine. It is like a 5 stars little hotel.

What a great and unique deal! Secluded without feeling disconnected, privacy without inattention, eco-friendly with all the comforts of nice accommodations -- plus a lot of sweet (literally!) little extras here and there, ample complementary snacks and staple foods to tie-over in a pinch, not to mention delicious samplings of fresh local fruits & snacks to really make "downtime" in this wonderful garden-place a treat to savor, rain or shine. My travel buddy arrived several hours after me, entailing a long drive across the island at night to collect him; when Kaeo realized this, she immediately offered to prepare a plate of food for us so we could come straight back and relax. She was making what would prove a lovely roast chicken with ample sides. She asked about my friend's diet and I mentioned that he is pesco, but surely we'd do fine munching on whatever she was making. However, Kaeo insisted on cooking up a nice little Ahi steak, just for him! The welcome wagon from both Kaeo & Karl was warm indeed, beginning with enthusiastic and detailed arrival guidance a week before our stay, and they tended to our few needs while there seamlessly and with complete discretion -- we never saw either of them again during our stay until Kaeo dropped by the morning of our departure to send us on our way with a warm goodbye. Binders chock full of local interest and maps gave us everything we needed to make the most of our brief visit, and their lush and beautiful property was a constant feast for the senses, both inside and out. A very different kind of stay experience, with a quality that can't be judged in relation the usual lodging options, but a fully and beautifully conceived package all its own. While deeply immersed in the local situation -- running water is pumped from a catchment, power is solar and to be used moderately, and the free wifi provided is a mobile hotspot with a limited data plan -- everything is nicely done (all the lights work, hot water is great, purified drinking water is provided, and the internet is there whenever you need it) -- we wanted for nothing. This is no cabin in the woods but a thoroughly pleasant, modern, modest yet comfortable, fully-appointed abode with everything you need (food and cooking stuff, nice personal care & bathroom products, fun things you might need for day trips, etc), steeped in the slightly wild Puna and the sense of sharing in the good life that Kaeo & Karl have lovingly built and nurtured here. The booking and transaction couldn't have been smoother; all we had to do was leave HI sales tax in the envelope provided when we left.

We had an exceptional experience at Eco Hale! We were greeted by  our friendly host who showed us to the hale and explained all of the amenities. She had packed the hale with fresh friut, goodies, and and all sorts of thoughtful extras.  We had everything we needed to make ourselves at home. The pictures don't do this accommodation justice- it us even better in real life. The hale is set in  lush tropical gardens. The finishings throughout are well crafted and creative- bamboo mouldings and lovely tilework. It has large windows and lots of light.  It is also very clean and well cared for.  During our stay we got a lot of rain, but it didnt hold us back from being able to enjoy the many fun things to do in the area which are all fairly close by: exploring the town if Hilo, trekking through Volcano National park, and doing tons of snorkelling. A huge bonus were the snorkel gear and boogie boards our hosts provided for us to use!!  We would highly recommend Eco Hale to anyone looking for a peaceful and fun place to stay while on the big island. Our hosts were awesome. They gave us lots of privacy, while making us feel special and well cared for during our stay. We would definitely stay at Eco Hale again!

Kaeo is a wonderful host, she makes us feel at home.  There was fresh fruits, home made bread and other good things to eat at are arrival.  The little cabin is well equiped and very comfortable.  It is a special experience to live in the rainforest where it rains all the time. At night the bugs and frogs are singing. The volcano parc and the city of Hilo is near.  We like are experience.  Thank you Kaeo and Karl.

I stayed at Eco Hale for four nights and loved it. I arrived around 7pm the first night while it was getting dark but the directions supplied by Kaeo were excellent and I easily made it there. Kaeo greeted me and showed me to the guesthouse and it is super cute. Private room with sink, microwave, refrigerator and a gas burner to cook. The bathroom is right next door, also private, with hot water and also is so nice. The decorations in the room and bathroom are really great and you can tell Kaeo and Karl have put a lot of time into making the Eco Hale feel like a home, and it does. 

Kaeo and Karl have provided all the necessary kitchen items for it to be a home, plates, cups, pots, pans, french press, fresh fruit, condiments, lots of snacks, everything you could need and more. Kaeo is also a fabulous cook and sweetly made me some baked goods and breakfast a few times while I was there. I really enjoyed talking with Kaeo, she and Karl have really created a wonderful life on the Big Island  off the grid and super comfortable. 

Kaeo also has great knowledge of the area and great recommendations for hiking, snorkeling, etc. There are snorkels, boogie boards, cooler, beach chairs, books about hiking, birds, towels, anything you could think of really, available for use by guests. They have also prepared a huge binder of information about the area that I found extremely useful. 

The location is great, in between Kea'au and Volcano and it was a quick trip to beach/snorkeling and excellent hiking in Volcanos National Park. Their home is in a beautiful fern forest and there are lots of birds during the day and singing coqui frogs at night. Sleeping to the sounds of frogs is the best. Kaeo is easily reached by phone, text, or going to her house if you need.

I can't recommend Eco Hale enough. I would love to live there myself!

Kaeo and Karl were wonderful hosts. The room is tucked away in the (Website hidden by Airbnb) was so peaceful listening to birds right outside the window--it was difficult to leave the room everyday! If you are lucky enough to try Kaeo's homebaked goods, they were delicious! We would definitely come back again next time we are on the Big Island.

Cet endroit est magique,un petit coin de paradis au bout du monde, au milieu du parfum des fleurs et du chant des insectes. L'accueil de Kaeo était vraiment très chaleureux. L'endroit est décoré avec beaucoup de goût , tout est très propre, il y a plein de petits cadeaux à boire et à manger et tout le confort nécessaire. .C'est vraiment délicieux de prendre sa douche en regardant le jardin. Nous avons adoré cet endroit et nous le conseillons vivement à tous ceux qui aiment la nature

We were greeted warmly by Kaeo late in the evening when we arrived at Eco Hale. The place is amazing! We have to say it is the best place we stayed in for our entire trip. There was so much complimentary food, we couldn't finish it all! The lodge is isolated from the road, surrounded by exotic (to us) plants and animals and although it is a small drive from Hilo - trust us, it is worth it! The bathroom facilities were even better than some other bnb places we stayed in. Although, because it's an eco lodge, the water needs to be pumped every so often and if you go to the toilet in the middle of the night - it will wake the neighbours! Overall we rate it 9/10. You fall asleep to soft rain and the sounds of melodic (though a local pest) frogs and wake up to fresh fruit for breakfast. What more could you possibly want?!

I was greeted warmly by Kaeo when I arrived. There was such a wide variety of complimentary and homemade treats from Kaeo that I felt staying there was such good value. Eco Hale is immaculately clean and the bathroom was one of the best I've ever stayed in. I liked how Eco Hale is isolated from the road, in a rural area, and out of the tourist area, yet a good point for exploring Puna and Volcano and Hilo. There is nothing I would change about my experience at Eco Hale other than I wish I had stayed a few days longer as it was relaxing and one of my best memories on the Big Island.

To choose EcoHale for our one week stay on the BigIsland was the best what we could have done. The EcoHale is as described, a beauty pearl in the nature. We had such a pleasant stay, waking up in the morning in a wonderful nature paradise and going to sleep with all the sounds of the garden was an extremely nice experience. Kaeo&Karl are so nice, they prepared everything perfectly and gave us so much threats. What else could we wish more. The property is very close to the main attractions of the island. It was the perfect spot to start exploring BigIsland and the perfect spot to rest and enjoy life.

We are very thankful for having met Kaeo&Karl. Thank you very much.

I am very glad I had chosen Kaeo's and Karl's EcoHale for my last days on the Island. I was very warm welcomed and they showed me around. It is like you have your own little paradise. The love to details in the decoration made me feeling like home. The EcoHale was very clean and very thoughtful outfitted. It feels like you have a bit of luxury with all the decoration and the beautiful built bath room next door. They provided a lot of extra goodies, like fruits and homemade bread. There were also chairs, boogie boards, snorkel gear and towels you could take to the beach. I can highly recommend their place for adventurous travelers that want to relax away from the crowds and enjoy the rainforest with all its fragrances and the sound of birds and frogs and still being close to major tourist attractions. I am very grateful for this outstanding experience and if I make it back to this beautiful Island I will stay there again. Mahalo to Kaeo and Karl, I just loved the place.

We loved it! Very special place, relaxing and clean with all the basic amenities. The hosts are very friendly and welcoming. If we could, we would have stayed a few more nights. After three weeks in Hawaii, this place was one of our favorites.

Our time at Eco Hale was a highlight on our trip, and Kaeo was the most gracious and thoughtful host.  We arrived after dark and she warmly welcomed us and walked us from our car along a fire-lit path to the beautiful cottage.  She then brought us a tray of delicious hot food!!  The next morning, finally able to explore the kitchen, sleeping area and gorgeous bathroom in full sunlight, we couldn't believe all of the careful details and amenities that Kaeo has placed throughout.  Everything you could imagine needing or wanting away from home is there at your fingertips.  
Eco Hale, in Mountain View, is a tucked away location, but it was centrally located between three areas that we wanted to explore: Hilo, Puna area, and the Volcano National Park.  The cottage is about a 20-30 minute drive from each of these spots.
We are already talking about going back!  This place is very special!

Kaeo and Karl were absolute gems! We had such a wonderful time at the Eco Hale that we didn't want to ever leave. From the fruit and fresh fish to the wine and honeymoon goodies, it was all so magical. We especially loved all the cute decorations and extra touches that made our stay so much more personal. The "kokee" frogs were also so fun to listen to at night and Kaeo and Karl were the most fantastic of hosts. Thank you!

Kaeo could not have been more friendly, kind or generous.  She gave both my wife and I a warm hug on our arrival and greeted us in Hawaiian.  Other kindnesses included:  a greeting with our names on it written on a board with different colors of chalk, giving us a bottle of wine and a hand written poem for our 25th wedding anniversary, providing a breakfast of fish and poi on our final morning.  The cabin is incredible.  It is private and surrounded by beautiful gardens.  We went to sleep at night to the sounds of frogs and woke up to a beautiful sunrise every day.  Highly recommend that you stay here.

What a neat place.  Elevated  to greatness by Kaeo an incredible hostess.  The area around the hale looks like someone set off a plant bomb and the world exploded into infinite shades of green.  We arrived to Kaeo's open armed welcome and were enfolded into the Hale's womb.  All fun aside... It is obvious that Kaeo and Karl have put a lot of thought into the place.  With all kinds of things supplied for your enjoyment. You aren't just renting a room you are learning the spirit of aloha from the lovely Kaeo!

Kaeo and Karl,
Thank you for hosting us at Eco Hale last week. We had an amazing time and felt just at home. We wish to go back soon, and stay at Eco Hale again. Kaeo, you are extremely generous. Your hospitality, the numerous details, treats, and the special you decorated and maintain Eco Hale is an inspiration. Thank you for the amazing guide book (binder); we found it very useful. We enjoyed having beach gear to enjoy around the island, as well as the well equipped kitchen for our dinners at night. We will miss the sound of the frogs and the relaxing rain. MAHALO!! Natalia and Charlie, Austin, TX.

What an oasis! We loved our stay at Eco Hale. One can tell how much love has been put onto making Eco Hale the perfect getaway for travellers from near and far. Set in the middle of Kaeo and Karl's beautiful and extensive garden that felt like being in the middle of a tropical paradise. Kaeo was there to welcome us warmly and show us around. There were useful instructions in the room as well. What makes Eco Hale even more special are the personal touches. The beautiful welcome sign, the homemade quiche, bagels and soft drinks in the fridge, a bottle of wine from the region, beautiful fruit from the Garden, tea, coffee, creamer, cookies, nuts, herbs and spices… the list could go on. The toiletries in the bathroom were also lovely. To lie there at night listening to the rain and the sounds of the night was just something else. In fact we so enjoyed being in our little oasis that we spent more time there and less time racing around every single site Big Island has to offer. Instead we ticked off our must dos but left off our if we have time list as we found peace and tranquility at Eco Hale. I would highly recommend anyone spending time in Hilo and Volcano area of the island to stay with Kaeo and Karl at Eco Hale.

Eco Hale embodies the spirit of "E komo mai, nou ka hale" or "welcome, my house is yours."  The reviews are glowing and well deserved, but Eco Hale is the kind of place that you really need to experience to understand.  Eco Hale was built in a rain forest paradise.  This place is the real deal.  If you spend your entire vacation at a resort you will miss the authenticity and aloha that Kaeo and Karl give.

We enjoyed four beautiful nights here.  Each night we kept the windows wide open.  The sweet scent of flowers poured in on the cool moist air.  Rain kept the rhythm while coqui frogs sang their little hearts out.  Controversial as they are, I now know why Puerto Ricans love the coqui.  Hear them in a soft rain, in the cool of evening with the lights down low, and you may believe the legends.

Eco Hale sits well off the beaten path and is accessed through a network of quiet two lane roads.  The hale is warm and comfortable.  The surrounding garden is Eden like.  Inside and out, the host's attention to detail is remarkable.  Eco Hale is a place to appreciate and return to.  Malama pono, a hui hou!

Kaeo and Karl were the perfect hosts! They gave us detailed instructions on how to find their place with a photo of the gate which led us there with no problems.
On arrival we found home made quiche, cookies, banana bread and fresh fruit waiting for us, which which was very unexpected but oh so nice. From the moment we arrived we felt like we were home! The eco hale was everything they had advertised or as and more! Their gardens were amazing, and it is on a perfect location to explore Volcano National Park, Puna district and only 20 miles from Hilo. We went to the supermarket and made all our own food but if you wanted to eat out there are restaurants at the nearby Volcano Village and also just down the highway toward Hilo. 
Overall we had a great stay and would definitely come back again. I recommend anyone to stay here!
Thank you Kaeo and Karl your Hawaiian hospitality was above and beyond! :)

This is the perfect idyll in the rainforest, surrounded by the sounds of nature and beautiful plants. It's an 30 min drive to volcano national park or to Hilo, so there's a lot to see. Our time there was way too short! 

The house just lovely and fully furnished, you can just find anything you could wish for and a lot more. Kaeo and Karl are perfect hosts, they greeted us warmly and provided us with lots of fruits and cake. There's also a big map with personal notes what to see and do around there. We would love to come again!!

This is such a hidden gem! With clear driving instructions we found the cute Eco Hale in no time! Thanks so much for making this Eco Hale a home away from home Kaeo and Karl! It is so fully equipped including all cooking essentials, teas and coffee (premium!), cakes, snacks and drinks (enough for 2 day hikes for two people!), towels, rain gear for hikers, change of pants (both male and female sizes), tops, all sort of snorkeling gears, boogie boards, beach chairs, etc etc, even fresh fruits from the rain forest in the backyard! Sitting at the steps, sipping teas while listening to the birds and frogs at night with the tiki torch on was something unforgettable. The bed is just COMFY! 

Kaeo and Karl has been so generous, they offered to dry our towels using their dryer when it was raining and invited us to a lovely Thanksgiving dinner! The stay at Eco hale was the highlight of our Hawaiian trip. Kaeo knows the island so well and has given us great tips on where to go and what to do. We were so happy to see some green sea turtles on our last day at the black sand beach, thanks to Kaeo! 

We strongly recommend Eco Hale to anyone who is about to visit the big island. You will LOVE the unique experience! Great location especially for volcano hikers! Would definitely come back when we visit the big island again!
This place exceeded our expectations. Clean, private and filled with many extras... if you need it you'll likely find it. I highly recommend this place and hope to visit again.

Eco hale was everything that we were looking for- a rainforest getaway that is private and remote, but still in close proximity to Volcano and other sights that we were interested in Puna. The location was perfect for exploring the east side of the island and we thought the east side had lots to offer if you are looking for adventures on the big island.
Kaeo and Karol were gracious hosts who made us feel welcomed and right at home. They thought of everything for you so you can just relax and enjoy your tropical rainforest escape. The extra treats are a big cherry on top that shows that they really go above and beyond to create a unique experience for their guests.

Kaeo is a born host, a warm and welcoming person who wants to nurture and feed (!) her guests. She knows that her Eco Hale is an unusual place that attracts people who want a different experience of the Big Island.

This is our second trip to the island, and we opted for airbnb hosts instead of the resort experience, precisely because we wanted contact with real people and their lives. We got this here - just the right amount. Kaeo and Karl were present but never invasive; always helpful and sweet. Kaeo also cooked an amazing meal for us - seared ahi on salad, perhaps the best dinner we have had on the island. We started off a 2-week trip by decompressing off-grid here. We’d say this was just the right amount of time to get a taste of this lifestyle.

The home is exactly as pictured, with perhaps more luxuries than you’d imagine - plenty of soft towels, well equipped mini kitchen, and even warm fleeces and pants if you didn’t pack your own. The bathroom is accessed by the lanai, something that’s hard to understand from the photos, adding a fun novelty to the experience. We loved the comfort of being inside, sheltered from but living with millions of birds, abundant plants, and the sound of rain. Their rainforest garden is the real thing, and we enjoyed the novelty of juicing a few citruses directly from the trees.

we spent three nights at this perfectly calm and amazing piece of earth. we were greeted by Kaeo who was amazingly friendly and helpful. the little house has everything you'll need... and more! we found many complimentary food such as freshly baked cookies, sodas and fruits from the garden. Kaeo's hospitality was the best thing about the stay at Eco Hale! we would totally recommend staying here!

Arriving at Eco Hale was like arriving home!  It is clear that a lot of love and thought went into the design and implementation of the hale and property, from the lovely little kitchen to the gorgeous bathroom, the lanai and the beautiful forest garden.  It was quiet and private, very cozy and clean.  Kaeo was an amazing hostess- she accommodated our schedule, left us sweet honeymoon treats including fresh fruit, a bottle of wine, sweet breads, and all kinds of little goodies.  A bonus- there are binders of amazing information about the area that Kaeo and Karl have put together over the years- it really helps to put your stay on the island in perspective.  Staying at Eco Hale is perfect for exploring the southern part of the island, including Hilo, Pahoa, the amazing Volcanos National Park, etc.  Mahalo nui loa for your kind hospitality!

We had such a nice time at Eco Hale! Everything was really clean. Kaeo was there when we just got at the house and she showed us everything around. There is everything you need for beach days and snorkelling, really nice. I also enjoyed a lot the fruits trees just beside our room! I highly recommend that place.

What a splendid few days at Eco Hale. The property is situated on the same plot as the owners Kaeo and Karl. It has two rooms - a compact and cosy bedroom and kitchenette and a separate bathroom with shower and toilet reached by a covered porch. The whole property is a treasure trove of items collected and useful to enhance the stay. We loved the isolation and enjoyed laying in bed listening to the noises of frogs and other jungle creatures at night.
If all this was not good enough, then you get the hospitality from Kaeo. Among many other things there was a lasagna waiting for us in the fridge and a short time later Kaeo reappears with a plate of yummy Sushi. There were all sorts of kitchen herbs and spices, coffee, teas - well the list goes on for ever. a huge bowl of oranges was left ready encouraging a morning ritual of squeezing for juice. Kano herself was a mind of information about sights and the local area and had a wicked sense of humour. Thank you very much for making our stay a most enjoyable one.

A great place to do the most important part of a vacation - relax. A nice blend of natural and simple, but at the same time very comfortable and clean. There has clearly been a lot of thought in the design and layout of the building, grounds, furnishings and decorations which all make for a very pleasant stay. The building is situated such that the main house is largely obscured, and yet there are views all around of the rain forest. This was our base for exploring volcanoes park and the Hilo area, but we had trouble leaving before noon because we were so comfortable enjoying our lazy mornings at Eco Hale. We also enjoyed Kaeo's hospitality from all the fruits and rum raisin breads waiting inside to the veggie lasagna our first night, and advice on local sightseeing. 
The bed was very comfortable, other than a few tree frogs (which I found rather pleasant) it was very quiet which made for a great sleep. 
They have also equipped the room with all sorts of items for both cooking while you are there (pots and pans and utensils as well as spices, sauces,etc.), as well as enjoying activities in the area (snorkels, masks, fins, beach chairs, rainjackets, flashlights, beach towels). 
they have really put a lot of thought and effort into making it a very warm and comfortable place to enjoy.
We look forward to a return trip.

We had a great time staying at the Eco Hale. It is conveniently located close to Volcano, but a bit far from Hilo and the beach areas. The drive off the main road over to the property is somewhat intimidating at first. However, waking up to the lush rainforest surrounding the Eco Hale makes the extra miles well worth it. The Hale was spotless, very comfortable and had everything we needed. It is located separately from the main house on the property, with it's own driveway; making it feel like a private cottage (loved that!). Kaeo was a formidable host and had many little touches that made our stay memorable. It is easy to see that she and Karl put a lot of heart building the Hale and making it so unique. Thanks again for everything!

My husband and I enjoyed our stay.  The night sounds of birds and crickets combined with the morning little lizards on the trees outside greeting us made a peaceful vacation.  Excellent location if you want to spend the day at the Volcano National Park (20 min)-try the Iki trail or visit nearby Hilo-45 min away.  Hilo has the rainbow falls, small beach parks with great snorkeling (we saw 7 sea turtles). The location is about 2 hours to Kona and the west coast--the built up resort side with the restaurants and coffee plantations- so think about where want to spend time most on the island.  

 From the moment we arrived, Kaeo made us feel welcome.  There were all sorts of treats, fruits and drinks waiting.  Even oranges for fresh squeezed oj and fresh baked yummy bread. The place is small but Eco friendly and well done for space, especially the bamboo and window bathroom area--note the bathroom is separate from room (via the porch/lanai).  The hosts were so responsive-we had an issue with the shower and Karl fixed it right away.  

There are kitchen supplies for cooking on the outdoor gas burner, a small fridge, coffee maker and French press.  
They also have beach chairs, beach towels, snorkel gear, flashlights and other items that are helpful.  All in all a nice place and wonderful hosts!

Kaeo greeted us when we arrived and showed us around the Eco Hale, making sure that we felt comfortable and knew where everything was. The tiny house was furnished with lots of supplies for cooking, extra bedding and warm clothes, lots of books about Hawai'i, and plenty of gear for the beach. There were also binders of information about the Hilo/Puna area. Since we had traveled from Seattle, we found all of this stuff really helpful! Kaeo had also left fresh fruit and snacks for us in the kitchen as well as flowers in the bathroom. Our evenings in the rainforest were super-relaxing -- a perfect counterbalance to our days snorkeling, hiking, and swimming. We had lots of privacy, but also we knew Kaeo and Karl were close by in case we needed anything. By then end of our week's stay, we felt really spoiled, in fact! They made our trip to Hawai'i extra special' and we're already looking forward to our next stay at the Eco Hale.

Kaeo and Karl are the best hosts one can imagine! There are so many lovely details like fruits and cookies and even a welcoming board with our names on.
All you need is provided in the small bamboo house, and the bathroom is so cozy with it's big glass wall through which you seel the rainforest garden.
The place is very far from the mainroad so one just hears the birds and coquis in the night. And the rainforest garden is really very beautiful.
Kaeo sent a very understandable description of the way in advance so we didn't have any problem to find the location.
I really can recommend the place when you like to have it quiet and closed to nature. A great experience. Thank you both for all!!

Wer erfahren möchte was Aloha bedeutet, ist bei Kaeo und Karl richtig. Es sind wunderbare Gastgeber. Die Unterkunft ist traumhaft.
Auto empfehlenswert.
Wonderful stay at an amazing place with unbelievable nice hosting! This place will be a highlight in every vacation. Thank Kaeo and Karl for all the nice food and service.

If you want an authentic Hawaiian experience, and to feel the true meaning of “Aloha”, look no further. Make your plans to enjoy time at this sweet rainforest retreat aka: Eco Hale. 

Like so many others who’ve attested to the sincere hospitality shown by hosts Kaeo and Karl, I fully concur. It was exemplary. (You can trust these reviews!) They give you everything you need, including your privacy. And so easy to work with, flexible and accommodating. 

Having said this, listen up: this place is not for everyone! It is very unique and best suited to intrepid and savvy travelers. This is not a Hilton/ Disneyland version of Hawaii. There is no room service, or ice, but there is good wifi! It’s situated in dense tropical rainforest which is what I loved about it BEST! Think: remote, private, rain, sunshine, more rain, birdsong, rain, sunshine. Quiet. Comfortable. Ah, bliss!

(Rain is considered a blessing in Hawaii, it is beautiful to hear and see, smell and feel.  But no worries, you tan-seeking sun-worshipers, the sunshine makes a strong presence known as well... they take turns. 

If your dream is to experience Hawaii - the “real” Hawaii - rest assured, you will find it at Eco Hale. Go ready to slow down and enjoy paradise.

What an awesome stay!  My husband and I desperately needed a vacation and Kaeo & Karl's hale in the rainforest was absolutely superb.  We were lulled to sleep by the coqui frogs every night, stuffed full of incredible food and fruit, and felt completely pampered by our hosts.  It was indeed very private, very comfortable, and very clean.  

They had absolutely everything you would need for fun on the island: a cooler for picnics, boogie boards, snorkeling gear, beach towels, sunscreen, recommendations for places to see and things to eat -- all of it.  They had plenty of coffee, snacks, and fruit to get us through most of our meals (I'm still full, oof!) 

They managed to be delightful hosts, but gave us plenty of privacy.  We communicated by leaving notes on the outside table (where they refill the water jug and take away your compost). They often left fresh flowers when we were out - it was lovely!   The icing on the cake was when they did a load of our laundry for free halfway through our stay (It was desperately needed!).

You won't go wrong staying at this wonderful place!

We were immersed in a Hawaiian rain Forrest, cozy in our cottage. Besides a spacious bathroom, the cottage had a comfortable bed, small refrigerator, some delicious food and local fruit awaiting us and on a covered porch a delightful camp stove on which I cooked breakfast each morning. Kaeo and Karl were friendly, very helpful and accommodating, stocking the cottage with everything one could need including binoculars that I had forgotten. We would gladly come again.

This place is just magic. It is quite an adventure to get there but once you arrive in this beautiful garden you will just love it. 
As it was my first airbnb experience I was very excited. But everything was just perfect. Kaeo was super friendly and gave me a great and warm welcome. She had great advice for what is there to do. I got a very delicious dinner at the first evening. And thanks for all the fruit! 
Everything you need is in that beautiful house, even a rainjacket !!! :) actually I forgot mine on Oahu so I was pretty happy for that one. I suppose Kaeo and Karl put so much love in this house - you definetely will feel that everywhere! 
The bathroom is just great and very clean! You have plenty of privacy and if you get to catch Kaeo you have some nice chats! (I didn't get to know Karl but I am sure he is just as lovely as Kaeo is)
I had a really wonderful time there and enjoyed the dark nights with a lot of birds :-) 
Mahalo for this unique experience which I will always keep in my heart! 
Franziska

So special! Eco Hale is perfect. Kaeo and Karl are fantastic hosts and very loving. Kaeo made us dinner the first night which was fabulous and also left us some treats which were fabulous. She didn't know this, but our anniversary was on the 18th and she brought us a big piece of chocolate cake. It made me so happy and we felt spoiled. The house is super clean and I just loved everything about it. The natural soundtrack of the birds, frogs and rain are so soothing. We utilized the kitchen for 4 meals and they had everything we needed as far as cookware, dishes, salt, pepper, etc. The gas on the burner ran out and they were so quick to replace it for us. Literally the most loving/giving people I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. They left us with fruit as well and there is a cool tree house that we ate dessert on one of the nights. Its just very peaceful and great to see that part of the island. The location is about 20 minutes to Hilo and 20 minutes to the Volcano park. Kaeo and Karl, thank you so much for the hospitality!! We will be recommending to all our friends that come for a visit.

Kaeo 

We just loved staying here.
We only met Kaeo during our stay and she is an incredibly welcoming, mindful and warm hearted person - she made us feel home from the moment we arrived. Actually the whole communication has been super smooth and easy too. 

We got a detailed description about the way and Kaeo was there to show us around when we arrived. What can I say, everything was provided in a very special and cute way! 

The cabin has the cozy bedroom with a very comfortable bed and a kitchensink. There is space to store some luggage and food too, but you will find almost everything there to use too. Kaeo stocked the fridge with some goodies and fruits - we enjoyed so much. 

Next door, connected by the open air veranda and cooking-bar, there is the very special bathroom. The glass to the jungle is so great, kind of jungle shower-feeling! The bathroom is so clean!! As the whole cabin is. 
It was the 49th acommendation we stayed in, during our round the world trip and it has honesty been the most clean and most spiritual one. 

Everything is there- clean linen, good towels, quality toiletries, complimentary food items, the "good night chocolate", fresh fruits, drinking water, Big Island Information, a meditation place with a yoga mat, bodyboards, snorkeling gear, nice dishes and cooking items, great and fast gas cooking plate ...

The place is laid back, super calm and quite far away from everything. We loved the crickets chirping and jungle sounds during the night. Hilo is about 30-40 minutes to go, and there are some great organic food stores and a farmers market. 

The wifi is slow and limited and I haven't been prepared there will be an additional tax to pay due to departure when we booked. It was mentioned at least in the confirmation, but I just haven't seen it. It can be very cold up there near Mountain View too. 
Kaeo and Karl were very welcoming with our Little One too. The cabin is small but nevertheless they arranged her a cute and cozy mattress and provided a lovely book!

The energy there is lovely and inspiring. This place is just a gem and ideal for some relaxed time, hiking the volcano and enjoy open air cooking with a view. 

We all can highly recommend this pristine place - it is full of love and flow. 
Thank you, dear Kaeo and dear Karl!

We absolutely loved it here!  Kaeo is the most delightful hostess!  She made us feel so welcome and cared for, the "best host award" is well deserved.  This gorgeously hand-crafted bamboo home is very clean, supplied with snacks, beach gear, warm clothing (for those cold volcano viewing nights) and anything else you could possibly need for your stay.  The one acre yard is full of trees, plants, flowers and cute Coqui frogs.  We wished we could have stayed here longer and would come back in a heartbeat!

A perfect location to go for hikes to the volcano nationalpark! Its a realy beautiful decorated and clean Room/Bathroom in the middle of a Rainforest (looks- and sonds like Rainforest) just beautiful!!! Dont wait and book it now! Kaeo came outside and showed us all things about the place...how to park, how to close the gate...she was very helpful. We didnt talk much about what things we can do in this area, but there are many recomanded things which you can find in a book. Thank you again for this little paradise, the sweets, the lemonade and all the small welcome-signs!!

My wife and I enjoyed our stay emensly. The accommodations were as described, clean and very comfortable. Kaeo and Karl were wondeful hosts. Freshly made breads and fruits were provided at check in for our stay and they were delicious. They provided attentive service while at the same time giving us privacy. They even baked a birthday cake for my wife's birthday.  The separate cottage style room was set in their lush, tropical rainforest property. Very peaceful and quiet. The nightly rain and coqui frogs made sleeping great. When/if we return to the big island, Kaeo and Karl's Eco Hale will be our accommodations on the Hilo side of the island for sure.

I can express how amazing our experience was at Eco Hale. Absolutely beautiful space and a perfecting launching point for all the fun in the area. Kaeo was very helpful and accommodating! We hope to return again!

Had an amazing time at the "Eco-hale"! Karl and Kaeo were lovely hosts - very welcoming and full of knowledge about the local area. The hale is beautifully presented and very comfortable for 2. Everything has been thought of - snorkelling gear and boogie boards, plenty of things to cook on, umbrellas, beach towels, torches... I could do on. Kaeo had also stocked up on all the essentials for us (like salt, oil, condiments etc) as well as provided home baking and fruit for us! We felt so looked after. Location is abit out of the way - which means it's very quiet but also abit of a drive to get anywhere but the place more than makes up for it. Our best Airbnb stay so far :)
Thank you very much for the cute welcome note, fruits, and pastry!! Your place is amazing! Location is great; we loved falling asleep with the sounds of nature! I've forgotten what it felt like :)

PAMPERED AND PRIVATE!  Kaeo and Karl are the quintessential hosts - with fresh fruit, home made treats and lots of Aloha spirit.  We spent four days basking in the tastefully decorated ohana enjoying cool mists, lush rain forest sights and sounds after beaching and hiking.  Unbeatable choice.

If you plan a trip to the big island and see this listing, do not think twice about booking this place! 

Dan and I have been to a lot of airbnb places, and we have never received such a warm welcome and stayed in such a special place surrounded by nature. The hut is very clean and super comfy, so is the bed. Kaeo had provided us with fruits (papaya, avocado, lemons etc.), the most amazing home made banana/macademia/apple bread, a freshly made salad and pie, yoghurts etc. The kitchen is also fully equipped to cook (pans, pots and all you need to cook with). The bathroom is really nice, it must have been newly renovated. During the 3 days we were there, we had full privacy. 
As to the location, it was perfect for us. It is only a 25-30min drive to volcano's national park, so you could go there every night if you wanted, and it takes about the same time to get to Hilo. This place is definitely a jackpot! Thank you again, Kaeo for sharing this wonderful place with us.

Our 3 nights in Eco Hale were so peaceful we didn't wanna leave. To feel asleep with the sounds of nature has no price. Kaeo is so welcoming. Thank you for all your treats and advices. You represent the aloha spirit. We felt at home  ... 
We'll definitely come back. 
Mahalo ! Merci

Staying at eco hale was an amazing experience for me and my sister. Though we did not get the chance to meet Karl, Kaeo was so sweet and friendly, making sure we were extra comfortable. I asked her for nail clippers in a note, and she not only left me clippers, but also nail polish and other nail products! From the special tea they provided (in my profile I mentioned I enjoy drinking tea) to the cute decorated chalk signs welcoming us, Karl and Kaeo are all about the thoughtful details that make you so glad you stayed.

The place itself is very neat and tidy, with a larger bathroom than expected. Coming into this, we knew it was a bit more remote, so we were fine with the limited wifi and no air conditioning. The area around the place is like a tropical paradise, and there's a little wooden platform in a tree that is great to sit and enjoy a beer on. We were very happy with our stay there and highly recommend to those who want a nice getaway into the beautiful Hawaiin scenery.

Dès qu'on a mis les pieds à EcoHale, on s'est senties privilégiées d'y être. Accueil chaleureux. Tout était bien pensé : petites collations sur place afin de ne pas avoir à ressortir faire l'épicerie.

Le logement est bien situé, à 30 minutes d'Hilo et tout près du Volcanoes National Park (environ 20 minutes). L'épicerie la plus proche est situé à Kea'au, à environ 20 minutes.

Endroit parfait pour paresser et profiter des sons et odeurs de la rainforest! Le logement est hyper propre, les photos représentent très bien la petite cabane.

Merci à nos hôtes!!

From the moment I set foot in the property, Kaeo immediately welcomed me with a warm smile and fresh flowers. The property is beautiful with all the lush greenery and flowers. I fell in love with the place as soon as I saw it - it was clean and I had everything I needed and more. I was delighted to find a delicious ravioli dinner in the fridge waiting to be heated and after Kaeo showed me around and told me where everything was, she came back with a delicious salad. I also had a giant tray of fresh fruits that lasted my entire stay plus tasty cookies and pastries. I loved hearing the sounds of the rainforest and the home had everything I needed for my stay - beach chairs, snorkel gear, boogie boards, beach towels, sunscreen, water and a cooler. 

Kaeo and Karl made me feel like ohana and I felt very safe and comfortable right away. It really feels like a home away from home. The neighborhood is great and the directions were perfect - I didn't get lost or turned around at all. It is located very close to the volcano and to Hilo - very convenient. Also, K & K happily answered any questions I had and provided recommendations on places to go and eat.

I had a memorable stay and as far as people go, you can't get any better than Kaeo and Karl. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Kaeo met me out by the gate, and welcomed me with open arms. She cooked me a homemade fish taco dinner the first night, and also left homemade cookies and bread, not to mention fresh fruit. Their property is amazing - quiet and lush. The Eco Hale was well appointed with anything a person traveling could need. Bed was comfortable and clean, bathroom was beautiful and clean as well. Would definitely stay here again! Thank you both so much!

Our stay at Eco Hale was wonderful. Very close to the Volcano National Park. 30 min tops. Since we were so close we were able to go back twice and stayed in the park later. Had we been in Hilo or further, we may not have and really missed out. The accommodations are exactly as described.  It is unusually warm all over Hawaii so be ready for that at night.  Thank you Kaeo for your attention to detail!  I was thoroughly impressed by it!

I had such a great experience at Eco Hale! The location was perfect for exploring both Hilo and Hawaii Volcanoes National Park. Kaeo was so welcoming and hospitable and provided many amenities that made my stay very comfortable and relaxing. I would definitely recommend staying at Eco Hale to anyone traveling to Hawaii! Thank you so much Kaeo!

We loved our time at Eco Hale! Wish we could have stayed longer. Kaeo met us as soon as we arrived and immediately made us feel welcome.  The place is so cute and cozy.  We loved the way it was decorated and it had everything we needed.  Although small, the bedroom does include a fridge, sink, coffee maker, french press, kitchen dishes, utensils, etc.  Outside on the patio is a propane burner to be able to do some simple cooking. The fruit and sweet breads provided were delicious! The bed was sooo comfortable and we loved listening to the rain and/or frogs at night. The view into the beautiful gardens from the bathroom was amazing.  When we arrived back to the hale after a long day there were motion sensor lights to lead us to our door.  We thought that was a thoughtful touch.  We didn't get to meet Karl but enjoyed talking with Kaeo about living in Hawaii.  She was generous with her time!

There are no words to describe the amazing hospitality and kindness Kaeo and Karl showed my wife and I for the 5 nights we stayed on the Big Island. The location is amazing if you are wanting to see the Volcano National Park, there is a Black Sand beach very close in Kalapana about 20 mins away from Eco Hale. The house is very cozy and romantic but definitely only able to comfortably accommodate two at the maximum. Also if you are wanting a resort experience free of culture, a little dirt, and nature you might as well stay in Kona. The Hale is truly off the grid and we couldn't have been happier with it. 

Being off the grid doesn't mean roughing it though. If you use the (provided) citronella candles on the porch bugs aren't an issue. The hot water is instantly hot, and a full kitchen setup is provided albeit a little unconventional. 

The hospitality provided for us was unlike anything you could ever dream of at any resort however. Kaeo provided us some treats and sandwiches upon checkin after getting in late and made us feel right at home, even offering to share some tasty Lasagna she had made for herself! We had a little bad luck with the weather pattern as it rained nearly everyday but Kaeo was there to take care of us and made sure we had clean and dry towels. 

Between the home cooked meals, homemade cookies, homemade bread, and fresh fruit, Kaeo was always there for advice on what to see, tips on the grocery stores nearby, farmers markets, etc, etc. We really did feel like family and cannot wait til our next visit to the Big Island!

- John and Carrie
Thank you for the nice hospitality. The location is quiet, the room clean and nicely decorated. Good breakfast with many home baked bread, cakes and cookies. We enjoyed our stay.

Gorgeous little guest house. Great hosts who suprised us with little things and h ome made food. We definitely recommend this. A truely fanstastic experience to sleep in the rain forest next to the volcano. Loved it.

We had a fantastic time. Kaeo and Karl were wonderful hosts. They were happy to help when we needed something, but they respected our privacy. They gave us some great tips about nearby spots to check out. For breakfast, they set aside fresh fruit right from the trees outside, plus some treats like cookies, coffee cake, and chocolates. We felt very welcomed.

About 5 miles from the main road, the Eco Hale was really the best of both worlds: it was rustic and away from it all, but it still had comforts like hot showers and a mini fridge. The property is just gorgeous, with all sorts of fruit trees and tropical plants around. Being city dwellers, it all felt a little magical.

Kaeo was the best host anyone could ask for.  The grounds were beautiful and the lodging was great.  They have thought of everything you need and were very accomodating.  I have nothing but praise for them

Staying at the Eco Hale was hands down the most amazing Airbnb experience we ever had. When we arrived, we got an exceptionally warm, hearty, and savory welcome from Kaeo. During our stay, we kept communicating with Kaeo & Karl via little text messages - so we were always eager to come back in the evening and find a kind little note on the porch.

The Hale is beautifully located in the middle of the rain forest, yet provides everything that you might ask for. We listened to the sound of the rain and the Coqui frogs at night and were woken up by the first rays of the sun piercing the canopy in the morning. What an enchanting and pristine place and what a great way to spend a vacation!

Our stay at the Eco Hale was truly inspiring and we'll definitely be back should our travels ever lead us back to the Big Island of Hawai'i. Thanks so much, Kaeo & Karl!

We spent three days just trying to find all of the thoughtful ways Kaeo and Karl had tried to make our stay special. From dinner the first night, to fruit on the counter, to the well-built and maintained property we were well cared for in every way. The notebooks of information were jam packed. This place is a ways off the highway but is so private that it makes you feel like you alone on the island. We loved it.

This truly was the greatest place we've stayed at! The most beautiful surroundings and Kaeo & Karl were great hosts. They offered the most attention to detail I've ever seen, varying from their collection of notes featuring personal recommendations in the wider area to providing fruit/snacks and lots of hidden quirks! Would definitely recommend.

Nice cottage in Volcano (20 minutes from the national park). Somewhat remote. 
Kaeo welcomed us well with fresh home-made banana bread and showed us our space. We stayed for 2 days and our experience was somewhat mixed. 
Be sure not to use GPS to get here since the roads are not paved - Kaeo will remind you of her detailed notes and instructions she provides (which is somewhat hard to follow without a map). While we enjoyed staying in the cabin, it's not everyone's cup of tea since its rather remote and rustic. The cabin is stocked with fruits and breakfast items - a nice surprise. Our interaction with Kaeo was mixed - sometimes friendly and welcoming and other times quite abrasive which made us feel very uncomfortable on more than one occasion. Overall, we probably wouldn't stay here again.
Un petit paradis sur terre !!! Perdu dans la nature, cette chambre est un  sanctuaire de la tranquillité. Nous n'avons pas vu Karl mais Kaeo est d'une gentillesse peu commune... Bref un super moment.

We arrived at Kaeo and Karl cottage under a stormy rain after driving the whole afternoon from Kona. It was so dark that we barely could see the car in front of us. It was hard to see the streets and landmarks Kaeo sent on the very detailed directions weeks in advance. So I recommend arriving when there is light. Kaeo was the most amazing hostess. Her first question was if we had dinner and since we said no, she immediately said there was quiche on the fridge and brought us a delicious salad. We had a great dinner inside the cozy cottage. The cottage is very comfortable with a queen size bed, four pilows and lots of covers for the chilly nights. The kitchen is full equipped and the bathroom very spacious - it is a separate room, so you need to go outside and enter the next door. The water is hot and the shower has good pressure. The cottage is totally isolated with a private lanai and garden full of beautiful plants and flowers. The famous banana bread was on the fridge and it was yummy! Next day we got fruit muffins, also yummy. You have to have in mind that you are in the middle of tropical rain forest with the next "town" (Volcano village) 30 minutes away. So come with all your adventurous spirit. It was a great experience and Kaeo is really one of the best hostess ever. She thought of every single detail and demonstrated really care for her guests. Mahalo Kaeo!!

Kaeo and Karl were truly Super Hosts! They go above and beyond to make you feel right at home. This was our (my husband and I) first time traveling together and it was very special and I thank Kaeo, Karl, and their charming little place for making it special. We even took our wedding pictures in their topical garden. The tropical garden is beautiful and full of tasty fruits! Kaeo even baked us a banana papaya bread (using ingredients straight from the garden) and it was hands down the BEST banana bread I've ever had! Eco Hale is located in a beautiful rainforest part of the Hawaii and it was a relaxing trip. Coming from a big loud fast paced city the sound of the rain, birds, and animals was just peaceful! We slept with the windows open during our 7 day trip and it was the best sleep I've had in awhile. We really liked that the place is eco friendly. I really recommend this place if you enjoy nature and trying to escape the city life. Its perfect to unwind and be free.

Eco Hale in rainforest was one our favorite places to stay.  They thought of everything and made us feel very welcome.  Kaeo surprises that were left for us each day we stayed were very nice starting with the quiche on our first night to the cookies on our last day.  The area surrounding the Eco Hale was extremely beautiful. Would definitely stay here again when we return to Hawaii. Kaeo was very nice and made us feel right at home. Eco Hale was very neat and clean as well as organized (like I said they thought of everything we would need).
Kaeo and Karl's cabin is very comfortable and in a good location. They were very generous with providing fruit, soup, fruit juice, and other goodies. Very good value!  I recommend!  Mark

Dear Kaeo and Karl,
Thank you so much for sharing a piece of paradise in the rain forest! Coming from the drought in California it felt so good to smell and feel and tear to rain! Surrounded by juicy green, flowers and birds we relax in your oh so cozy Ecohale. You are doing a wonderful job in creating this peaceful and beautiful place. We appreciate your hospitality and Drew are some surprises! Thank you so much for your treats and the beautiful gift. We love it! It will always remember us off the great time we had staying with you! Mahalo e Mele Kalikimaka!

If you are looking for a short sojourn in paradise then head for the ecohale. The cabin is thoughtfully equipped and we departed inspired by the welcoming details left all around; it takes a lot of hard work to make a place like this so effective at developing the relaxing atmosphere we found ourselves ensconced in.  Many thanks to hosts kaeo and Karl; mahalo!

After spending our time in the last weeks on Oahu, Kauai and Maui we came to Big Island and the Eco Hale Lodge.
Especially after sleeping the last weeks in more"colder" apartements the Eco Hale felt wonderful.
The place is as discrebed very private and fully equipped with everthing what is thinkable.
The bed is really comfortable.
Everthing is clean and in a very good condition.
From our perspective it is the perfect place to stay on Big Island.
We would like to thank you for all the complimentarys and hospitality.
It was overall a 100% perfect time and stay for us.

Kaeo and Karl's presence on Airbnb goes beyond a simple vacation listing. The space itself is lovely: simple and well-appointed, with everything you need and more, while the surrounding property makes you hesitant to ever leave.

No, it's the extras that make it special. We were greeted with a lovely home-cooked meal, in addition to more fresh fruit and snacks than we could possibly eat. There was equipment for snorkeling and exploring the beaches made available free of charge. And we kept finding little surprises, from the hand-lettered welcome sign to the tree house toward the back of the property to the pages and pages of suggestions on what to do in the area.

Most Airbnb listings are for a place to spend the night. Kaeo and Karl share pieces of themselves and their lives, while offering you all the privacy you need. This was truly the most memorable experience we've had in 3 years of using Airbnb.

Kaeo and Karl provided us with a wonderful, private residence to stay in while visiting VNP. Kaeo greeted us upon arrival and made us feel immediately at home. We are very grateful for both their efforts and highly recommend this listing to others.

We just got back from a 2 wk vacation on the Big Island and Eco Hale was our favorite Airbnb experience.  I had worried it would be too small or remote but for us it was the perfect Hawaiian experience.  Kaeo met us in the drive as if we were old friends coming to visit.  We had communicated by text the day before about our expected arrival time and need to go grocery shopping.  As noticed in other reviews she promised us some vegetable pasta upon arrival saving us a trip from Volcano Village back to Hilo for supplies and allowing for more time to explore the National Park. The grounds around Eco Hale are lush with flora and fauna plus quaint garden art.  We could tell much thought was put into the decor of the Hale, food & drink treats, and general household items and beach gear available for our use. It was like staying in a Hawaiian playhouse.  We made much use of cooking equipment at night on our little porch after shopping at local Farmers Markets. The above pasta was delish as was fresh banana bread left on the kitchen counter. Garden fruits and other food staples were available in the frig and pantry.  The bathroom was large and there was plenty of hot water and drinking water available.  My husband and I are types who when on vacation are up and out early, back just before dark, and tired from our long day so Eco Hale could not have been a better choice for us.  The location is perfect for exploring the HA Natl Volcano Park and the entire Puna area.  We particularly loved the night sounds, sort of jungle-like.  Wish we had booked more nights at Eco Hale for there is much Aloha there.
Wonderful stay in an enchanted garden paradise. Every need thought of and cared for by the host.  Can only recommend if you are looking for a peaceful and quiet place on the Big Island

Kaeo and Karl's Eco Hale cabin was a wonderful little paradise in a lush Hawaiian rainforest/garden environment.  We wish we could have stayed longer.  We kept in touch with Kaeo and Karl to let them know our flight arrival was a bit late and they were OK with letting us come on ahead.  We arrived after dark and had no problem finding the gate.  If you follow Kaeo's directions exactly and keep an eye out for the numbers on the street pavement as indicated, you won't have any trouble.  We felt welcome as soon as we arrived as Kaeo promptly and graciously introduced herself and handed us a piping hot tureen of delicious vegetable and soba noodle soup, which we devoured.   Kaeo got us all set up with keys and additional information and left us to our own devices.  We sadly didn't meet Karl as he had family in town.  Upon entering the cabin, we were also pleased to find a selection of home-grown and local fruits on the counter that was more than we could eat...but we tried!  Kaeo also brought us a loaf of home baked banana bread (delicious with coffee and fruit in the morning) and cookies for us (which saved us on one of our long hikes in the park).  
The cabin information and photos that were provided in the listing were accurate, so we knew what to expect.  The main room in the cabin is a fairly small space, which we expected, but was large enough for both my husband and I to move around, prepare meals, eat, read and sleep.  Eco Hale is perfect for a single or couple.  It was very clean, cozy and comfortable.  The kitchenette area is well set up for making your own meals by outdoor gas single cook-top, or indoor microwave, a bar-sized sink, and a small fridge.  There were plenty of kitchen tools, plates, pans, coffee grinder, french press, as well as condiments, coffee beans, teas and other amenities.  The bathroom with shower is separate and spacious with plenty of on-demand hot water and room to change in.  Eco Hale was centrally located between Hilo and Volcano National Park so it was easy for us to move between each location.  We were amazed at the attention to detail in this little cabin from the artistic decorative touches, inspirational quotes, our own personalized welcome sign which made us feel special (thank you!), extra reading materials, local information and to-do recommendations, beach and snorkeling gear, ice chest, recycle bins, drinking water, extra pillows and blankets, a cd player with a box of cds that we enjoyed, internet hotspot, playing cards, a guest book, a hide-away tree platform, and so much more! 
All this is to say, we highly recommend this little gem and these wonderful gracious hosts.

It was a pleasure staying at Kaeo and Karl's place. The unit was small but very well equipped and was perfect for me and my wife. Waking up in a rainforest setting was definitely a treat.

Other than the well appointed unit, we were also provided numerous other goodies such as assorted fruit, a poke bowl, numerous juice/pop/beer, as well as wine for our honeymoon.

We really couldn't have asked for a better host and a place to stay. Privacy was not an issue as the unit was completely separate from their house. Do not hesitate to book this - you will not regret it!

This place is fantastic! It's a little off the beaten path but the area is beautiful with colorful flora and fruit trees. The cottage itself is cosy, comfortable, and had everything we needed and more. We never met Karl but Kaeo was a warm and thoughtful host who generously prepared some delicious meals. Best quiche ever! We didn't even need to bring as much food as we did because of the welcome and farewell dinners as well as fruit and yogurt for breakfast. Thank you for a wonderful experience in the rain forest.

Kaeo was indeed a SUPERHOST. Eco Hale is TRULY an Aloha experience. WE LOVE YOU. We used the GPS and kind of got lost even though K&K gave us clear instructions how to navigate. I was lazy to get the printed driving instructions from the truck of the car. But she found us struggling and came out and helped us in every single step. The hospitality!!! It was like I came to my paati's(Grandma in Tamil- sorry Kaeo - only the love part. Not the age as you young at heart. ) place. Frankly you don't have to leave this place if you want to spend time with nature. The room was exactly like described. It has everything you will need and more. The avocados , oranges, tangerines and more fruits. The cookies and fresh banana bread. Yummmmyy. They have a "Things and stuff to know" VNP travel manual which has EVERYTHING you will need to know abt the park.

Mahalo and Aloha!!!

Our stay at the Eco Hale was beyond amazing. To say Kaeo and Karl thought of everything would be an understatement. The space is small, but perfect and cozy. The windows in the bedroom and bathroom are all oriented to let in the most gorgeous natural light in the morning and throughout the day.  It was so nice to wake up there each morning. The sounds of nature at night are soothing and put you right to sleep. We were celebrating a birthday and Kaeo greeted us with dinner, dessert, and a bottle of champagne. It was really above and beyond. We couldn't have asked for a kinder or more welcoming host. We would definitely return!

My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Eco Hale for the first part of our honeymoon.  Kaeo was wonderful and met us with hugs and smile.  There was a light supper which was amazing after a 22-hour flight!  The Eco Hale met our expectations and more.  It is definitely off the beaten track but this allows for an amazing amount of privacy.  You feel as if you are staying in the middle of a tropical jungle.  The Eco Hale is small but has everything you could ask for.  The extras, such as the snorkel gear and cooler, were perfect for day trips.  We really appreciated the fresh fruit and muffins and all the extras in the kitchen.  This was our first Airbnb experience and it exceeded our expectations!

Kaeo and Karl were the perfect hosts. Knowledgeable, personable, considerate and thoughtful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in their section of paradise. The space was welcoming and comfortable. The surrounding forest was surreal. We greatly enjoyed falling asleep to the tree frogs every night and waking up to the birds in the morning. Perfectly located between Hilo and VNP. I can say with confidence this has was, by far, my greatest Airbnb experience. Kaeo and Karl thought of everything you could possibly need to make the stay as comfortable and wonderful as possible.

Excellent place. It was super clean and the attention to detail was perfect. We were provided with awesome cake and quiche on our arrival.  The place was easy to find since the directions provided were spot on. The place has everything you need for an awesome vacation

My wife and I stayed at Eco Hale for 3 nights on an anniversary trip which also included stays at The Royal Hawaiian (Oahu) and Sheraton Kona Resort (Kailua-Kona). Without question, our fondest memories of the trip are the ones we made here. From the moment we pulled into the driveway, where Kaeo welcomed us as if she had known us our entire lives, we felt the special-ness of the place. The cabin itself is beautiful, clean, and filled with personal touches. It strikes the perfect balance between offering just enough modern convenience to feel luxurious (electricity, hot water on demand, etc.) while eschewing things like television which would detract from the natural beauty and intimacy of the setting. This is truly a place to step back, slow down, and relax. We loved falling asleep to the sound of the rain pitter-pattering on the roof and the frogs chirping outside the windows. Also, the location is ideal for exploring the volcano and the Hilo side of the island, which we ended up far preferring over the Kona side. We met several folks at the Kona resorts who only did day trips to the volcano, and I think that's a tragic mistake. The eastern side of the island is far more lush and beautiful, and offers numerous hikes, vistas, waterfalls, and gardens for those who appreciate that sort of thing. We followed several of Kaeo's recommendations and were not disappointed. In short, we could not recommend Eco Hale more highly, and hope one day to have the opportunity to return.

Mahalo, dear hosts, for this perfect place
For Eco Hale is truly a sacred space.
In your rain forest so lush and green
Colorful gardens with flowers and fruit wait to be seen.

In this cottage so cozy and sweet
You frequently left scrumptious (many homebaked!) treats
The tastefully chosen bamboo decor
Reflected nature's gifts outside our door.

Our sensuous showers under the tree canopy nearby
And hearty breakfasts indoors OR on the lanai
Prepared us for hiking volcanoes, waterfalls and more
On this, Big Island's, stunning east shore.

And then, at the end of the day, with YOUR slippers on our feet
We curled up in our candlelit cabin with your plentiful books so neat
Listened to the melodies of tree frogs and birds
And fell asleep as the patter of rain was heard.

When we think of Hawai'is beautiful nature
We will remember what you at Eco Hale nurture
Thank you for your ALOHA -- the joyful sharing of life energy --
And for Eco Hale, an unforgettable sanctuary.

When we arrived in Hawaii after a long and somewhat arduous journey with a 9-month old baby we were welcomed with actual open arms by Kaeo.  She was so kind, caring, and open and we felt instantly at home.  
We were greeted with a delicious dinner and each day would come home to find mandarins, oranges, lemons, avocados, and delicious home-baked treats at our door step.
Both Kaeo and Karl were incredibly helpful in planing out stay, and even though we knew we could always go next door to ask them questions, we also felt that we were completely alone and isolated in our little jungle retreat.
The accommodations were clean, neat, and simple but small, so if you aren't comfortable sharing a small space with your traveling partner know that you'll be in close quarters.  Despite the size the Hale never feels small or cramped and everything is organized so perfectly that you'll wonder why you ever thought you needed so much space!  We loved the experience (and challenge) of our outdoor kitchen and found ourselves cooking delicious meals with local produce and will forever miss our fresh-squeezed juices each morning.
You're definitely off the beaten path here, so be prepared for some driving (30 minutes and up) if you want to go the National Park, beaches, or into Hilo.  We felt it was well-worth it to do the extra driving.  
Its also good to note that this is an Eco Hale in the Rainforest- so be prepared for rain!  While your days might get wet, falling asleep to the sound of rain and coqui frogs singing can't be topped!
In short, our time at Kaeo and Karl's was wonderful, special, memorable, and beautiful and we HIGHLY recommend it!

Best place you could wish for, not only because of the amazing little place, but also because of the incredible nice hosts! I didnt get to meet Karl, but Kaeo . She was so nice and sweet and so much fun! She told us what we could do and had many cards/maps of places in a big folder in the condo. We got homemade bananabread, oatmealbars, tons of fresh fruit, the fridge was filled with drinks (limonade,beer) and on our first evening we got a big plate with food, small plated with seafood and amaaaaaazing pineapple cheesecake. everything you need is there. Its soo clean and cozy, bugs were no problem, as long as you dont leave the door wide open. We loved the big island, we loved this place and we loved having these amazing hosts. Kaeo even did laundry for us which was so kind of her, i couldnt imagine having a better host. This is a great choice to stay at.

Eco Hale ist ein toller Ausgangspunkt für Aktivitäten rund um den Volcano NP, nach Puna, Mauna Kea... 
Kaeo und Karl haben uns mit einem vollen Kühlschrank, frischen Früchten, Cookies und guter Küchenausstattung überrascht! Der wunderschöne Garten muss unbedingt erkundigt werden, man fühlt sich wie im Paradies!
Kaeo und Karl sind sehr herzliche Gastgeber und um das Wohl ihrer Gäste bemüht! Eco Hale ist ein Erlebnis welches wir nicht missen möchten!

Kaeo is a great host, friendly and full of energy.
The place was perfect! I will never forget enjoying the fruit at the breakfast bar with the most beautiful view! We are very glad we stayed with Kaeo. THank you!

If we had to review Eco Hale in one short sentence, we would say that we have never been treated with so much aloha during our visits to the Hawaiian Archipelago. Kaeo and Karl did everything (and more) to make our stay enjoyable. Their cottage has everything we needed and a lot more that we did not excpect. The surroundings are drop dead gorgeous- a carefully maintained tropical foliage, the sounds of Coqui frogs at night and birds in the morning make the scene almost surreal. The owners are friendly, helpful and give 100% privacy if that's what you require. Karl designed the cottage perfectly, the large bathroom window is overlooking the garden yet it doesn't make you feel uncomfortable (read- yes, you can walk naked all you want:)) Kaeo spoiled us many times with great local food and fruits, which we devoured immediately:)
The location is perfect for exploring Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park, the Hilo side of the island and it's not far from Hawai'i most amazing mountain, Mauna Kea. 
In overall, we can recommend Karl & Kaeo cottage in a heartbeat to anyone looking for a clean, affordable accommodation in the southeastern part of Big Island. Once again, mahalo for everything, we will never forget you and your great place and hopefully, our paths will cross again in the nearest future.

Our stay from May 7 - May 12, 2016 was good. Though we both did get massive bug bites during the night but oh well. Part of staying in an eco system I guess.

THe best part was the warm greetings for my girlfriend and I and all the delicious goodies (Too many to list). Thank you! :-)

The only downside to our stay was the whole trash separating deal.
I understand the environment and the eco system its in, but we got to the point where we just used our own trash bag and took it to dumpster in town as we were not to go through and separate everything.
Otherwise great place. And thanks for all your Aloha hospitality.
-anthony and renee
California
May 7 - May 12

This is one of the BEST Airbnb places I've stayed. We had detailed instructions for arrival, delicious fruits and snacks waiting for us. There was even a welcome signed customized just for us! The cottage is beautifully decorated and includes anything you would need even slippers, umbrellas and rain ponchos. There are several books about the area and the many things to do. The yard is lush with all varieties of plants. I loved listening to the noises of the rain forest. I asked Kaeo and Karl for a tour of their solar powered setup and rain catchment system which was very interesting. I have already recommended this place to other family members. It is a great place to totally relax and enjoy true Hawaii and not feel like a rushed tourist. I wish I'd booked for a longer stay.

A few words come to mind when thinking of Kaeo and Karl's place - beautiful, magical, serene, peaceful, authentic, incredible.
