Kaeo welcomed us in her driveway with open arms and led us into the private, rustic eco hale which is neatly tucked away in the middle of rainforest. The place is exactly as described in the photos and truly a unique experience for any traveller. We were also spoiled with homemade treats each day, which made us feel loved and cared for. The eco hale has everything that you would need for a rural retreat and so much more. We were pleasantly surprised to see trail guides for the day trips in the Volcanoes National Park, as well as blankets and hot water flasks for night trips to the volcano. Falling asleep to the sounds of crickets and birds and cooking on the patio with the rainforest in full view was also a delight. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a unique and unforgettable Airbnb experience. Definitely the best we have had a so far! Mahalo K & K :)

My husband, Trevor, and I came here on our honeymoon... we were simply speechless. Staying at Eco Hale was an experience of lifetime. Not only was it beautiful, but Keao was an INCREDIBLE host. She came to check on us and left us the most delicious baked goods we've ever had, and I'm assuming they were all made with local ingredients because they were amazing. Her banana macadamia but bread was my absolute favorite. We are from the east coast, just outside of New York City, so staying in the heart of the Hawaiian rainforest was truly something we will never forget and treasure forever. Falling asleep to the sound of rain on all the trees and the soothing sound of whistling tree frogs was a memory that we will hold dear to us for years to come. You are a short drive (15-20 minutes) from Kilauea or the town of Hilo in both directions. There are countless outdoor adventures, such as breath taking tide pools, waterfalls, and driving to the top of Mauna Kea (one of the best thing's we've ever seen), and being a short drive away from all these incredible adventures is just perfect. I really have no words for how awesome this experience was. To anyone thinking about staying at Eco Hale... DO IT - you won't regret it!
If I could give this a 1,000 star rating I would. We LOVED staying here, and would 100% come back. Thank you Kaeo and Karl for making our honeymoon everything we had dreamed of!!!!

We loved K&K's Eco Hale in the rainforest! We had such a great time - pure nature! It's very close to the Volcano National Park. Kaeo is an awesome host and more than happy to help or to answer questions! We would definitely recommend this place.

This was a very unique and the best airbnb experience we have had. Kaeo and Karl were very nice host. Kaeo welcomed us with hugs and so much aloha. Very beautifully designed house. It was just amazing staying here in the midst of rainforest, sleeping to the sounds of frogs and waking to chirping birds was a wonderful experience. We explored  Volcano National park, Mauna Kae from here. Kaeo had provided with cookies and banana bread and some food which were scrumptious. Kaeo has also provided all the amenities - binoculors, beach gear, slippers, large flashlight, books just to list a few! Highly recommend this place.

Nice little cottage next to the vulcano national park. Private beautiful  bathroom and outdoor kitchen. The banana bread, cookies and fruits were great and Kaeo was very helpful with everything. For sure we would stay here again! Sabine and Johannes

Loved staying at the Eco Hale, and we couldn't have asked for better hosts than Kaeo & Karl! We arrived late evening our first day in Hawaii, and Kaeo prepared a wonderful salad with sushi for our dinner. It was absolutely delicious. We were treated to such kindness and thoughtfulness throughout our trip: a bag of lychee fruits (because we happened to mention how we loved them, and saw a farm stand selling them), wonderful home-baked banana bread with macadamia nuts, a small vase of flowers. Sleeping in the hale was like being in the middle of a rainforest with the songs of frogs and birds serenading us. It's a magical place, and definitely one of the highlights of our trip. Highly recommended!!

It's a good place for healing insomnia, at least it worked pretty well for me. Before came to the big island, I stayed at a luxurious hotel in Honolulu for three days, I tried the spa for relaxing, and everything I thought may help, unfortunately, none of them works as good as stay in Eco Hale. In general, I do not tolerate any noise or animal's song when I'm sleeping. Surprisingly I could fall asleep in frog's relentlessly chirping noises without any pills. I have to say this is a fantastic place with magics! 
Beware of the mosquito! The extreme brutal creature could leave many huge bumps on your for a week. 
It's a lovely place for the single person, no disturbs or negative energies. You could feel safe and relaxed.
如果喜欢亲近大自然的感觉,这里应该是一个不错的选择｡如果为了便利和接近城市可以考虑其他｡绿绿的感觉看起很放松,不过注意蚊子很毒｡

Our stay at the Eco Hale was better than we could have imagined. Kaeo welcomed us with open arms and a well stocked fridge and pantry. We especially enjoyed the fresh fruit, banana bread, and the ahi she shared with us. Eco Hale is a great place to stay while exploring the nearby national park and the Hilo side of the island. We appreciated the provided beach towels, mat, and snorkels which we used at Kapoho tide pools. We would not change anything about our experience at the Eco Hale and hope to stay there again in the future. Mahalo Kaeo and Karl, and thanks for the parting flowers!

Staying in Mountain View with Kaeo and Karl is exactly what an adventurous soul needs. Their home is in the middle of the rainforest and their eco house cabin should be an example to each and every one of us that we can live in an eco friendly environment. They have everything you can think of for an adventure in Big Island. From snorkeling to hiking, they got you covered. I am still in awe with every detail that Kaeo and Karl have came up with in that house. It can't get better, it's already prefect!

Kaeo thought of everything!  Down to providing a Dr. Seus book for us to read to my toddler (we read it every night!).  There were welcoming snacks, fresh fruits, fully stocked fridge, and baked goods that Kaeo would bring over.  Super thoughtful and gracious host!  And it's only 20 minutes from the National Volcanoes Park.

Nice place in a tropical garden. A bit away from everything - you have to drive many miles to get something to eat. Kaeo was very friendly, but we saw her only when we arrived and Karl was a 'ghost-host' (we didn't see him). The only surprising thing was, that we had to pay additional $ 31.- on arrival in cash, which we didn't expect due to the information on the eco hale airbnb page.

This was an incredible experience! We spent a lot of our time near the volcano, so the location was perfect! It was very cute and quaint, and it had pretty much everything and anything you could imagine (food, amenity, cooking, etc.) Kaeo and Karl were very responsive and awesome to work with! They were very also very warm, generous and welcoming. With the beautiful touches they've added to the hale, the tranquility and peacefulness of its surroundings, it truly was a wonderful experience.

Great stay! Welcomed with a delicious light snack. Little snacks and amenities found around every corner: headlamps, yoga mat, fruit for a smoothie, fresh coffee beans, the list goes on. Kaeo was especially sweet since we weren't feeling too well and brough over fresh ginger and honey for tea. 
The location is secluded both within town and within the overall property. Beautifully landscaped.

Staying in Eco Hale was the highlight of our trip. We have traveled all over the world, always using AirBnB, and there has never been a host like Kaeo. She takes great pride in her space, and makes sure you have everything you need for a relaxing, complete stay. The difference with Kaeo and Karl and with Eco Hale, is the true experience of a Bed and Breakfast. There was everything provided from sweats and slippers, to a fully stocked kitchen, to the drinking water tank being magically filled every day, to a thank you note and parting gift at the end. Nothing was missed, and it made us feel welcome, relaxed, and at home far away from home. Even with all of these extras, we did not see Kaeo or Karl during our stay after check-in, and were given the privacy that allowed for a perfect stay. Eco Hale is a dreamy little spot with a magical bathroom and a porch perfect for playing cards, eating dinner, and listening to the rain and coquis. We missed making pancakes on the porch and eating fresh fruit every morning the rest of our trip! Such a perfect way to start your day. We only wish we would have booked it towards the end of our trip when that vacation exhaustion starts to set in and you want to relax in your accommodations! Kaeo has a passion for hosting and it truly shines through. We would recommend to anyone staying on Hawaii Island to stay here! Thank you Kaeo!

Thanks for great hospitality and food to us.
This place is very unique and good location for seeing volcano national park.

Wer ein Jungelerlebnis in der atemberaubenden Fauna von Hawaii sucht ist hier genau richtig. In dem mit viel Liebe eingerichtetem kleinem Hale findet man alles was man braucht umringt von einem Meer aus grün. Kaeo & Karl sind zwei liebevolle und warmherzige Gastgeber und helfen gerne bei Fragen.

Kaeo is an amazing person and host. My husband and I felt welcome from the moment we arrived. We were welcomed by Kaeo with hugs and a delicious chicken salad. The Eco Hale was spotless and exactly as shown in the photos. The bed and linens were very comfortable and the shower had great water pressure. The grounds are gorgeous and create a peaceful space ... we fell asleep each night to the sound of the rain in the trees and the coqui frogs chirping. 
You are really in the rainforest though it is an easy drive from Eco Hale to the Volcanoes National Park and to Hilo. We had just spent three nights in Honolulu and it was really wonderful to relax in such a peaceful setting for a few days. Also, our Airbnb experience in Honolulu was not the best, so we were so happy to arrive at Eco Hale and find everything just as described.
We ate breakfast and dinner at Eco Hale and took snacks with us for our sightseeing during the day.  The kitchen amenities were plentiful and we had no trouble preparing meals.
I am so glad we stayed at Eco Hale and highly recommend it!

We knew from the moment we arrived that Kaeo & Karl were wonderful, warm people. I would say that this experience was the perfect definition of "balance". 
-Balance between hospitality and privacy. (We knew they were there if we needed anything, but we were also totally free to come and go as we pleased. And we tended to leave early and arrive late, as we spent our days exploring the island.) 
-Balance between a getaway in the rain forest and accessibility to everything. (You fall asleep to the sounds of frogs, but are only a short drive from Hilo, Volcano National Park, Mauna Kea...)

If you are thinking about booking with Kaeo & Karl, don't hesitate!!!
It was amazing, and one of our favorite memories of the island. Thank you so much for your hospitality!

Kaeo and Karl made every effort to make us feel welcome and comfortable: a cold dish plate, beautiful ripe local fruits and coffee were waiting for us, along with a personalized welcome message on the little board with our names :) The place is a product of love - you can see that easily, and spend hours noticing all the lovely details and decorations in the hale and the tropical garden. We are highly recommending this place if you're staying at the Volcano area for a few nights (we stayed 3 nights - note that the place is tiny, so if you're not travelling light, you probably don't want to stay more than that).

Kaeo and Karl have created a beautiful space and made staying at their house a great experience. The house is immaculately clean, and stocked with everything you might need during your stay. Kaeo welcomed us with hugs and an amazing vegetable lasagna for dinner with a pineapple-cherry upside down cake for dessert. We made breakfasts with the local fruit and coffee, and enjoyed them on the porch overlooking their wonderful garden. They are a short drive from Volcano National Park, a great farmer's market on weekends, and Hilo. I highly recommend them if you are staying on the east side of the island.

Kaeo & Karl are extremely dear host.
Kaeo spoiled us with a lot of delicious home baking. Great.
Eco Hale is furnished with love and decorated as well.
Pure nature - away from tourism.

This was our first stay at an Airbnb location, and it fulfilled and exceed our expectations.  All pictures and descriptions are 100% accurate.  Our hosts were open, kind, and generous, and they made us feel like family.  They also have excellent local knowledge and are willing to share it.  If you would like to go to the volcano or to the lava flow in Kalapana,  this is a great location.  Detox from the hustle and bustle of life and spend your time here!

Eco Hale was a splendid little getaway to end our stay in Hawaii.  Kaeo was incredibly welcoming and while she made it clear she was available, we were provided some desired privacy.  The amenities on site were top notch!  The binder of recommendations led us to the Pahoa farmers market (which we thoroughly enjoyed) and the available cookware/supplies made us feel right at home when making meals.  Kaeo and Karl have really made this place a gem; there are so many wonderful little details which imbue Eco Hale with such great energy.  Truly a highlight of our stay.

The whole stay was absolutely incredible! Kaeo is the ultimate host, and the small treats and attention to detail make this stay easy to recommend. Everything was exactly as pictured, and the Hale was cozy and comfortable even on the rainy days. if you're thinking about staying here, definitely go for it. Bring a headlamp!

Where to begin...Eco Hale is truly a special place. Kaeo and Karl are amazing. They have everything covered from the accommodations to kitchen utensils to anything else you think you might need. We used the thermoses they had for our early morning trip to go see the lava...perfect!! Kaeo greeted us upon check in and gave us the rundown also shared info on key things in the area and recommendations. She had made us pork tamales and provided green salsa, cheese, and avocado.... so tasty and filling! The accommodations are spot on from the decor to the layout. They provide extra of everything so do not worry. The fresh fruit made for a wonderful breakfast  add on. Fresh baked banana blueberry bread was to die for!!!

I was truly sad to leave..we were only able to stay for two days but the memories will last forever!!! Kaeo and Karl...thank you for sharing your piece of paradise with us. Truly an honor and a privilege. Mahalo from the bottom of our hearts!!
I would look forward to staying here again. This place exceeded my expectations in all respects. Good job Kaeo & Karl.

The last time we stayed at the magical Eco Hale, we vowed to return. And happily, just two short years later, we were able to visit again! We love this place so much. And our host, Kaeo. We ADORE her. She is the loveliest. Hospitality incarnate.
The cottage itself is composed of two rooms: a cozy bedroom with a compact/efficient kitchen space and a bathroom that is impeccably clean with beautiful custom tilework lining the shower walls. The interior spaces spill out onto a small porch with more kitchen space and outdoor seating. There, you're nestled into a lush rainforest-garden, secluded from it all, and connected to the tropical surroundings in a way that can only happen in a place like Mountain View. The frequent rain showers, the warm sunlight through all the green, and the sound of birds and frogs envelope you in a whole new world. 
Kaeo has appointed every corner of the cottage with things to make your stay comfortable and memorable. Home-baked hiking bars and a beautiful tray of fresh fruit are just two examples of the many "gifts" you may find at Eco Hale. Twenty minutes from Volcano (current lava flows are spectacular), the Puna coast (dappled with natural lava-warmed pools and home to one of our favorite things--the Wednesday night-market), and Hilo (a fun town to explore which borders waterfall country) make this location ideal for exploring important must-see sections of the island. We love having Mountain View as our home-base and no doubt we will be returning once again.

Kaeo is the best host ever. (Haven't met Karl unfortunately.) We spent two Nights and it was absolutely awesome. It's a cosy and wonderful Place Filled with LOVE and good vibes! 
Delicious Banana bread, Cookies, wine, ripe fruits, Water was waiting for us - and even a Birthday Card and a candle. So warmhearted and lovely. Hope to come back again... MAHALO <3
Highly recommend!
Kaeo is an amazing host. Her place was very quite clean and it had everything we needed. Thank you so much Kaeo <3

We had a wonderful stay and Kaeo & Karl are amazing hosts. So many personal little amenities and goodies. Truly welcoming. The cottage is so peaceful and intimate. Very relaxing. It was a good location for our exploration of Volcanoes National Park and the Hilo/Puna area. It give the feeling of being secreted away in the jungle in your own intimate world. How cool! Exceptionally clean. Particularly given how it's situated. I spend a lot of time in out of the way cabins and none of them are as fresh and clean as this.
Amazing, unique garden cottage!

Absolutely loved staying at Eco Hale!  Kaeo greeted us upon arrival and was very friendly and welcoming, and provided us with some tips and recommendations.  We didn't see either Kaeo or Karl during our stay as they gave us complete privacy.  We had a few questions and Kaeo was very responsive to our text messages.

The whole place is amazing.  It feels like you're camping in the middle of the rainforest, but with all the comforts of home!  Very peaceful and tranquil location, perfect for relaxing after a day of exploring the Volcano National Park and surrounding area... loved watching the lava flow into the ocean at Kalapana!

We were greeted home each night by a chorus of tree frogs :)  The home is fully stocked with anything you could need and much much more.  The fridge was loaded up with various juices, water and snacks (including some fresh baked banana bread).  So many other things were provided... coffee beans, grinder & french press, bug spray, sunblock, beach gear, binoculars, flashlights, spare clothing, thermos, and much more.

Thanks Kaeo & Karl!

If you want a unique, Hawaiian living experience during your stay on the Big Island away from the hustle and bustle of normal life, look no further than Eco Hale! We enjoyed this cabin living lifestyle for the amount of time that we stayed in Hilo -- falling asleep to the sounds of nature outside was just heavenly! It was cozy, clean, and comfortable...close enough to the park and Hilo city, but far away from car and people traffic. ;) Eco Hale had everything we needed -- you could tell that Kaeo and Karl really put a lot of thought and love into the place!

And where to begin with all of the beautiful things that I want to say about Kaeo? She is absolutely the hostess with the mostest! She was always so kind and thoughtful towards us -- she left us the sweetest notes/tiny gifts and the yummiest treats from hearty potato soup to homemade turkey sandwiches (for turkey day!). She welcomed us warmly, was flexible, and respectful of our privacy. She was absolutely lovely and beautiful in every way! If you choose to stay in Eco Hale, you will, without a doubt, feel the love and warmth! Mahalo, Kaeo, and thank you for making our stay one of a kind!

We loved our stay at Eco Hale. The place was snug (so don't bring too many luggages!) but it had everything you needed plus much more. I loved our view when I made breakfast in the morning, where else can you stare out into the rainforest while making omelette? 

And Kaeo made it even more special. She was so thoughtful and kind. She had a snack waiting for us when we arrived and other baked goodies. Since it was raining a lot while we were there, it was really hard for our towels to dry so she would dry them for us and leave them neatly folded on the table outside, in a bag, every night. You really can not find this kind of attentiveness and care anywhere else.

We stayed at Eco Hale our first few nights on the island and absolutely fell in love with this cozy little house.  So much thought and Kaeo's personal touch went into making this a delightful  place to stay.  It's clean, tidy and beautifully decorated!  Everything you can imagine wanting/needing has been provided.  If I knew how wonderful our stay would be I would have booked it for longer.  Thanks again Kaeo & Karl!

When showing us around, Kaeo mentioned that she and Karl try to under-advertise and over-deliver with their Airbnb listing, and that's a perfect summary of our experience here. Amenities they made available to us included beach gear (snorkels, masks, fins, towels) and an abundance of tasty snacks. The Eco Hale is very private, nestled into a tropical garden away from the main house. If you're looking for a compromise between staying in a hotel or camping out, the Eco Hale offers the best of both worlds.

This is our best AirBnB experience up to date ! The location is beautiful  , the cabin is very cute and cozy . Kaeo is an amazing host - she has provided a cornucopia of delicious snacks and fruits. Thank you so much , Kaeo !

Incredible experience! My husband and I Honeymooned over Christmas at the Eco Hale. Kaeo's hospitality was so kind, so warm, so generous. The hale is cozy and well appointed. The location is off the beaten path, but nothing is too far away. We enjoyed being secluded in the rainforest with the gorgeous foliage and the croak of coqui frogs. All of the handmade treats and little extras really made it special for us, especially being away from home at Christmas. We'll be back! So highly recommended!

We stayed at Eco Hale for four days during our honeymoon in Hawaii and had an incredible time. Kaeo and Karl have outfitted this spot with everything you could need for the area - even including special treats when we arrived. The description truly delivers! It was a wonderful and tranquil spot to come back to after a day of exploring the area or hiking and a great place to relax, under the leaves of the oh-so-close rainforest.

This was our first experience with Airbnb and we could not have been happier. All the special touches made our stay at the Eco Hale unforgettable.  We would have been happy to spend many more days there!

The Eco Hale far exceeded our expectations and was the perfect spot to use as a base for exploring the Volcano National Park system.  Kaeo & Karl were friendly and highly responsive leading up to and during our stay there.  The cabin itself is impeccably clean and came stocked with much more than just the necessary items one would need, from cooking supplies and home baked goods to informational binders, headlamps, candles, etc.  The property is secluded in the rainforest and relaxing with a book or going to sleep to the chorus of frogs and birds is a  memorable treat. Would highly recommend the Eco Hale to anyone looking for quiet and solitude during their trip to this side of the island.  Thanks again K & K, hope to make your acquaintance again someday.

Me and my girlfriend loved our 3 nights here, a really peaceful rainforest retreat nice and comfortable with plenty of welcoming little extras. We didn't meet Karl but Kaeo was very kind and welcoming. Would definitely stay here again, but make sure you have a car if you're planning a visit.

Kaeo was absolutely wonderful! Lots of snacks provided, she  was also enormously helpful with things to do! So friendly and free flowing as well! We can't wait to come back!! I felt the location was perfect. The kitchen was well stocked, grills and "stove" out on the porch were clean and well working. My only complaint is that it's damp  and feels much colder than it is. Obviously you're in a jungle/rainforest so that's a given but the space only has 3 windows, no heating/air conditioning, fans. So to get fresh air you have too open windows/door and it lets in so much moisture. BUT the water at the space was hot when needed. Bed was springy, neither very soft or hard, lots of extra blankets and pillows. 

We were about 1-2 hours from everything we wanted to do. We went to a black sand beach, hiked the 5 miles round trip to the green sand beach, went to Hilina Pali, and saw snow on Mauna Kea (which is on the way to the airport). We found two health food stores, island naturals in Hilo (a one stop shop!), and Keaau natural foods who has raw macadamia nuts that are out of this world! After the green sand beach there is a yummy Thai place called is lae garden and just up the way a mile or so is a pizza place that advertised gluten free and vegan called DJ pizza. Stop at the kona brewery if you fly into kona. Their food is amazing, strawberry salad and sweet potato pie were A+!! Kaeo gave us great ideas and pointed us in the right direction to find what we wanted to do. She also has huge binders of info in the room of local things and volcanos. Really awesome! She suggested the boat tour for seeing the volcano and lava vs flying.

This is a quiet, secluded space perfect for those on the go all day and want a quiet retreat. Cooking was outside as well as bathroom door. Privacy was plentiful. Hosts are generous and knowledgeable about the area. Welcome snacks and food were great. The only downside was the weather.

This is a truly beautiful place to stay - unlike any other AirBnB that I have experienced before. Quite, peaceful and conveniently located between Hilo and the Volcanoes National Park. You will not find a kinder host. Directions for arrival were easy to follow and accurate. I would absolutely recommend staying here.

If you're looking to have a peaceful, private retreat in the middle of the Hawaiian rain-forest, this place is an absolute haven. I can't believe all of the little perks this place offers. Fresh citrus for us to pick in the morning, fresh fruit laid out for our breakfast (and the best banana bread i've ever had), the place is stocked really well just in case you need anything or forgot anything. Ka'eo was incredibly friendly and accommodating. We were so comfortable and relaxed the whole time we were there, we really wish we could have stayed longer. <3

Our stay at Eco Hale was special on many levels. So much thought and love has been put into the guest experience that you can just relax and enjoy. It is a small space and perfectly adequate...cozy is the word! We appreciated our hosts and the communication prior to and during our visit. And we appreciated the privacy they accorded us as well! Wonderful treats, travel tips and even a device to pluck fresh oranges from the bountiful tree out front. Yes, you will need to do some driving to the rainforest location, but the unique and memorable experience makes it totally worth it.

Everything was just as described on the airbnb website. Our stay was lovely and we very much enjoyed Eco Hale. It was exactly what we were looking for to make our trip feel authentic and adventurous with an upscale feel. We could fall asleep to the sounds of nature but had a very comfortable space with a lovely bathroom and emenities. If we are ever back on the Big Island we would definitely stay at Eco Hale again. The fresh fruit was so refreshing and the rainforest environment was romantic and private.

Such a great place to stay. Away from all the city noise. So so so peaceful. Exactly as described in the details. 

The Hale has everything you need. Cozy bed, umbrellas, ponchos, separate bathroom, snokerling gear, beach chairs, comfy bed, mugs, plates and some more. It also has a bunch of binders with all the information about the island. You don't even need (Hidden by Airbnb) for anything. Everything is right there in the binders. Can only imagine the amount of time they have spent creating those binders and keeping it up to date. But that is not the best part of the hale. Its the location location location. Its in the middle of a rainforest. And you fall off to sleep to the sounds of birds, rain and frogs. Never had a peaceful sleep like this before. It brought back memories of our native place back home. The pictures do not do justice to the Hale. You have to live there to feel it :)

I don't even know how to be grateful to the hosts. We did not get a chance to meet Karl but Kaeo was there to welcome us and was able to accommodate an early checkin request. She is such a wonderful lady to talk to. She is so welcoming and she really wants you to have a great time. We felt like a part of their family. There were fruits, baked goodies for us on arrival. And everyday she would leave something for us on the porch to eat :)

There is absolutely no reason for you to not stay here if you are visiting Hilo. Like I said, the location is amazing but the hosts are even more amazing. We had the best vacation of our life. And we'll defnitley come back to Eco Hale next time we are on the island.

To Kaeo and karl, we are forever in debt for the warm hospitality and for letting us be a part of your home. Mahalo from the bottom of our hearts.

P.S: The Hale is best suitable for two people. It's not very huge and no closet space so its best if you have minimal luggage. We had one check-in bag and two carry ons and we did just fine.

This was a magical spot! We got in late to a wonderful greeting and a dinner of pupus and treats galore! The frogs sang us to sleep at night and it couldn't have been more peaceful. The place was stocked with everything we could have need and way more. Thank you so much! We will return!
Go there!  You will love the cottage, peace & quiet, tropical surroundings, great hosts.  A serene place to settle into after a busy day of touring the island.  Highly recommended.

You couldn't ask for better hosts. Kaeo and Karl were very warm and welcoming. Everything at the Hale is organized to make your stay great. The property is a tropical paradise with lush beautiful gardens. We made fresh squeezed OJ each morning from the tree that is just steps from the Hale. You won't regret a visit here.

Wow! What can we say?
This little patch of paradise was perfect! I have never slept so well! The location is absolutely amazing! The sounds of the wildlife and the smell of the plants is intoxicating. We will remember our stay here forever. Kaeo and Karl provide everything you could possibly need and more! Boogie boards, snorkel and masks, flippers, towels, water, snacks, home baked treats, coffee, home picked fruits.....
The pictures on the site are beautiful but once you arrive it is even more stunning!
We can't say thankyou enough and we can't recommend this place enough either!
Beautiful, de-stressing, peaceful, Paradise!
Thanks Kaeo and Karl!
Oli and Coco xxx

This is a little slice of paradise off the beaten path!  The hale is planted in the middle of a rain forest garden and feels very private.  We never expected a eco stay to have so many conveniences!  Being off the grid felt luxurious and we really didn't need to make any sacrifices to remain environmentally friendly!  Kaeo met us when we arrived and welcomed us with food and baked goods that warmed our souls :) Words cannot express how beautiful the eco hale was, or what amazing hosts Kaeo and Karl were. This was an experience that will remain forever in our hearts.

This place is absolutely wonderful. The hosts are great. The location is amazing. The price is perfect. My wife and I came here for our honeymoon and we will never forget it! You have to stay with Kaeo & Karl.

Tolle Unterkunft mitten im Regenwald mit viel Liebe zum Detail gestaltet. Der dazugehörige Garten lädt zum Träumen ein. Wir haben uns hier super wohl gefühlt und viel erlebt (Volcanos National Park, Black Sand Beach,...).

Eco Hale is a perfect piece of luxury in the middle of the rain forest. The house is off the grid but provides all the amenities that a traveller could want including internet connectivity via 4G connection if required.

Kaeo and Karl provided local foods for dinner on the first night and enough fruit, banana bread, granola, yoghurt, cookies and milk to last our three night stay.

The cabin is small but contains everything we needed for a great stay near the Volcano National Park (approx 25min away). The bedroom and bathroom are very clean and well appointed and the setting is tranquil and beautiful. We would love to go back!

Kaeo and Karl’s Eco Hale is the place to be if you are looking for a cozy place to rest in the countryside of Hawaii. The Eco Hale is a wonderful end to daily adventures around the island. Nocturnal creatures serenade the nights, and the beautiful garden is a great place to relax if you tire from adventure.
Kaeo and Karl are great hosts. Warm and friendly introductions and lots of information which my detail oriented partner loved. I was pleasantly surprised by fresh fruit and baked goodies. The blueberry uffins made my day. I admire the life K&K have built for themselves, and I appreciate their willingness to share a piece of it with the rest of the world. 
This was my first Airbnb, and I am afraid that future hosts will face a high benchmark.

Being in the hospitality industry, I really noticed the extreme attention to detail. There was more offered than I could even attempt to enjoy. Kaeo has a true heart and you can tell the moment you meet her.

Very comfortable stay! We were warmly welcomed at check-in. We didn't spend much time at Eco Hale as we spent a lot of time exploring the Big Island, but we appreciated the food & fresh fruit provided and all the basics & extras (towels, toiletries, snorkeling gear, water, etc.)!

This place and the hosts are amazing. Its beautiful and super cozy. It has its own personality, a little piece of paradise. Hosts were warm and welcoming. You will be surprised by all the supplies and equipment available to you. Our "coup de coeur".

We had a wonderful stay here -- so much thoughtfulness and attention to detail.  Lovely location in the rain forest.  We were there during a big rainstorm and spent the entire day inside listening to the rain and the sounds of the forest. It was great!  We really wanted to feel away from the crowd and this place was perfect.  Truly a special spot with phenomenal hosts.

Little hidden gem in a great location, 20 mins drive to Volcano National Park and a great starting point to explore the eastside of Hawai'i island. Kaeo was incrediblly nice and responsive to any questions. The breakfast was great, overall a wonderful stay. We would definitely come back!

I had an awesome experience with Kaeo and Karl. Their place is just fantastic imagine you are in the middle of a rain forest with all the things that you need! They provide you fresh bread, healthy snacks, comfortable bed, flash lights, clean bathroom with organic aromatic soaps, shampoo and lotions. They have good internet, cookware, umbrellas, cozy blankets if you are planning to check out the volcanoes in the night and they have everything that you can think of. You feel like you are in ur house that is located at a rain forest. Their place is very close to restaurants, food land and volcano places.

Kaeo & Karl have created a beautiful little vacation home & do their best to anticipate their guests needs. Staying at their quaint off grid cottage is an excellent way to try out tiny home type living. Volcano Nat Park is close by BUT you do need your own transportation to easily get around. Expect to be loudly serenaded by coqui frogs at night & soothed by gentle rain.

Une petite maisonnette au milieu d'un jardin luxuriant avec pour seul bruit nocturne, le chant des grenouilles, que demander de plus? À oui, beaucoup d'attention de la part de l'hôte, une propreté impeccable et à deux pas du parc national des volcans de Big Island, ne cherchez plus, vous l'avez trouvé : c'est bien l'ecohale de Kaeo et Karl. Je ne peux que vous recommander ce coup de cœur si vous êtes un amoureux de la nature, un randonneur ou tout simplement un curieux.
Muchas gracias por todo, siempre recordaremos nuestra estancia en Ecohole!

We LOVE this place ! We had such a nice stay, Kaeo and Karl took care of us very well. We felt spoiled with good vibes, good tips and kind gestures. The little house in the middle of the rainforest was so lovely and confy. We recommend!

Eco Hale was a fantastic place if you want to experience living in a rain forest. Kaeo and Karl were so generous and caring hosts. We felt very well taken care of. We would definitely recommend staying here if you plan to visit big island.

Tout était parfait chez Kaeo et Karl! Un logement tres bien situé (près du parc des Volcans et du lava field), propre, tranquille et paisible. Les hôtes sont plus que généreux (beaucoup de nourriture fournie et cuisinée maison et pleins d'objets à notre disposition) et sympathiques. Je recommande fortement ce logement à tous!

We stayed at the EcoHale for 5 days during our honeymoon. It was more than we could ask for! Kaeo and Karl were gracious hosts. We appreciated the fresh fruit every morning, bottle of champagne for us newlyweds, and promptness with all of our communication. The volcano was only 30 minutes away from the EcoHale and was very close to all the amenities we needed. It was never more than an hour drive to get to our snorkeling, birding, and hiking. This luxury off-the-grid experience was everything we imagined! We enjoyed the sound of the birds in the morning and the coqui frogs at night (although, if you're a light sleeper like my wife, I would suggest a pair of ear plugs as the frogs can be pretty vocal). Thank you, Kaeo and Karl!

My husband and I stayed here, this cozy lovely eco hale, to celebrate our 4th wedding anniversary. It was ok to find the place because (Hidden by Airbnb) map guided us exactly the same as what 'aunt Kaeo' said to us before we arrived.  We came from South Korea, took 10 hours to get here, and this Eco hale was the reason why we decided to choose Hilo for our anniversary.
Our first impression on Eco hale was unforgettable. I couldnt believe what I see with my eyes! So beautiful, peaceful, and vivid with colorful trees and singing birds, and also with warm welcoming hug from Aunt Kaeo! She was so beautiful and kind! She explained details about this little 'wonderland' to us when arrival and we started to explore this little house. It is fit for two of us. There was everything we needed. Aunt Kaeo gave us a wine with a sweet memo and we really appreciate it! We could find delicate touches of Karl and Kaeo everywhere and could feel how they pour their love to this house. 
I want to say thank you so much that we had the most amazing days and nights in our life in this Eco Hale. Thank you for giving us a stunning memory. We will definitely come back! Mahalo nui :)

Ganz tolle Gastgeber! Die Unterkunft ist sauber und mit viel Liebe eingerichtet. 
Ein Auto ist empfehlenswert. 
Uns hat es sehr gut gefallen.

What a wonderful stay! It is very secluded but detailed directions made it easy to find, and it's right in the middle of a rainforest garden! Kaeo and Karl have done a fantastic job of recreating a lush tropical rainforest, and you are right in the middle of it. They also have provided snacks of all kinds and fresh fruit and juices, really making you feel welcome and special upon arrival. The sounds from the frogs in the forest at night are musical and enhance the feel of being in the forest. There are also many birds flitting around day and night. Make sure you walk around and view the different exotic tropical flora. The room itself was very comfortable and clean. Would definitely go back.
Peaceful, beautiful and perfect.  Words cannot describe the experience of staying at this beautiful retreat. A must stay!! 5 star

My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and we had such a great time. Upon arrival we were greeted with fresh baked breads, muffins, and tons of snacks. She even had a welcome sign, and a bottle of wine as a wedding gift with a very thoughtful note. Although we just met Kaeo it felt as though she was a long time friend. Eco Hale provided us with everything we needed and then some. Would definitely recommend!

Kaeo and Karl were wonderful hosts. This little house was perfect for our needs - it was clean, had a very nice garden, the bed is very confortable and we had full privacy.

Their generosity is just phenomenal. On our arrival, Kaeo have prepared us an appetizer which was gluten free due to my dietary restriction (it was very nice from her to pay attention to all the small details). Also, we had plenty of fruits on the counter, banana bread (really tasty) and other goodies in the fridge for the breakfast. During the week she also offered us a dinner that she had prepared during the day. Once again, she is a really good cook and we have really appreciate everything she was doing for us!

It is an amazing spot for those who like to hike since it is very close from Volcano. Many information on the trails were available in the information book in the house. 

During our stay, we had one rainy day and Kaeo was really kind and put our wet towel in her dryer in order for us to have dry towels the next day. 

We will recommend this place at 100% to everyone who is going to Big Island. 

Mahalo
Mel & Simon

We loved all the decorations and personal touches we found all around the hale. It made it feel so comfortable and homey. Kaeo and Karl had everything you could think of needing for your stay, and things you wouldn't have thought of as well (flashlights, warm clothing, binoculars, etc).

The many personalized guide books Kaeo and Karl provided were invaluable for us to get a local perspective to make our trip even better. They had so many suggestions that you can't find anywhere else.

One of our favorite suggestions from Kaeo when we arrived was the night market at Kalapana - great food, music, and people and a great way to end our trip!

First airbnb we've ever done. Nicest lady in the world, she was very helpful and warming. Really happy to have stayed here. 

(The frogs can be a little loud at night, but your living in the nature, cant control it)

è un giardino segreto nella foresta. meravigliosa location. esperienza unica in un'isola che è già bella di suo. e i prodotti per la doccia e il bagno che la proprietaria mette a disposizione sono organici e buonissimi. 
veramente un'ottima scelta per vivere l'isola in modo speciale.

My wife and I stayed at the Eco Hale in August of 2017 and thoroughly enjoyed the location, setting, and price. The description offered on airbnb is accurate. You are located in the Hawaiian rain forest in a beautiful garden filled with tropical plants. You have a great deal of privacy yet Kaeo is always a text/email away and eager to answer any questions you may have. You are a 20 minute drive from Volcanoes National Park and the town of Hilo. Various fruits, a loaf of banana bread, hot cereal, and pancake mix was provided for breakfasts. Yum!

Book the Eco Hale, you wont regret it! The property is beautiful and the hosts are great!
Beautiful location, made it feel like we were Tarzan and Jane living in the middle of a jungle! Truly a wonderful Hawaiian experience!

Highly recommend this peaceful and scenic little slice of paradise to anyone wanting to escape the hustle and bustle of every day life!

Kaeo and Karl were excellent hosts and gave us the utmost privacy but still managed to be interactive and helpful whenever we needed.

Would 100% stay again.

Thank you for the memories!

Had an awesome time at the Eco Hale! Kaeo was extremely welcoming  (we didn't get the chance to meet Karl). She made sure we had everything we needed and even provided delicious breakfast fruits, coffee, bread, and more. We loved being immersed in the rainforest and definitely would recommend a stay here.

A must stay! This location is perfect for the nature lover and romantic! There are so many positive things to say about this place we will keep it brief; 
- great communication prior to, at arrival, during stay and after check out 
- a welcome and personal greeting 
- amazing goodies and amenities ( if you forgot it they have it ! ) offered and provided 
- very private 
- great location between volcano and hilo, amazing setting in the rainforest 
- comfortable!
- very clean 

We highly recommend this place! We were very sad to go after our 3 nights! We will absolutely be returning ! 
Kelly and Kyle

We really don't know how any practical or aesthetic improvements can be made for Eco Hale...the attention to detail and comfort that Kaeo and Karl have for their guests is beyond superb. And if you like to be surrounded by a botanical diversity of plants , this is the place for you. A lot of love went into the landscaping. Eco Hale is the perfect place for seclusion as well as close enough to Hilo and many adventures along the south and west Hawaii.

Where does one start? First and foremost, you must try it to truly know how magical this place is. It's tucked away in the rain forest and was gorgeous! I was a solo adventurer for 9 days and loved everything about the place. Everything is there for amenities and I didn't need anything else. I went to the store and farmer's markets (plenty to choose from!) for the staples when I wanted to make any sort of meals for my stay which was nice. The fresh fruit, little treats, and yummy meals were a treat I wasn't expecting and they were so yummy!  I didn't meet Karl this trip, but his touches he put on building this beautiful humble abode was perfect. Kaeo is the sweetest and most adorable free spirit and I couldn't have asked for more from her! Her local tips in the binders are perfect and lovely for when you want to check out everything around you and across the Island. Very well put together! If I had a question while across the Island, she responded almost immediately with advice or tips. I loved falling asleep to the local wildlife and rain, as well as waking up to the beautiful sun shine and birds chirping. The tree platform was perfect for when I needed to just soak the sun and relax. Be ready to sit back and just relax with while staying at the Eco Hale. Kaeo and Karl have done such a wonderful job putting this magical place together to share with the world! I plan to visit again in the future and I have no questions as to where I will be staying on my next trip to the Big Island! Aloha and Mahalo K2!

Paradise in the rainforest
Very  cute, extremely clean and cosy, fully furnished cottage set in tropical gardens. Kaeo was an exceptional hostess, providing many more amenities than expected-food, toiletries and even first aid supplies, reading materials and extensive info on the region... We didn't meet Karl but his handiwork was everywhere to enjoy. 
Their Eco Hale is an excellent base for visiting the Volcano Park and south of the island. 
We fully recommend this haven of peace!

You will love this jungle bungalow tucked in a tropical rainforest paradise! Built and cared for by Karl & Kaeo, this is the perfect way to escape and experience a truly serene Hawaiian vibe. Amazing attention to detail and wonderful personal touches make this a delightful retreat. You may arrive as strangers, but will part as friends. Mahalo nui loa to Kaeo and Karl for memories that will last a lifetime!

Kaeo was a spectacular host! You could literally come to the island with nothing, and she'd have everything you need! She was so nice and offering her computer when we needed it. She graciously handmade a small dinner for us, accommodating to our dietary needs. It was delicious. The native fruits too! Yum.
This location of this place was literally in the middle of a rain forest. If you'd love to be close to the Volcano National Park and would like an authentic Hawaiian place to stay, this is perfect. It is a bit small if you have a ton of luggage, but luckily with the covered porch, we were able to set some of it outside. It did get a little humid in the room, so some airflow of a fan  you could run for a while would be nice. She does live "off the grid" using solar panels and rain water, which is so fascinating. Keep that in mind with regards to running electricity and water though.
You can really tell that she loves playing hostess. Out of all the places we stayed on the big island, even the Sheraton on Kauai, this was one of my favorite places to stay! Thank you again for everything.
Place was a small room but, a great place and very clean.  I would definitely stay there again!  This is the best place I have ever stayed in Hawai’i!

I’ve stayed at AirBnBs all over the world and Kaeo and Karl’s place has been my favorite. Communication and check in was simple. The property is in the middle of the jungle with all kinds of fruit trees. They respected our privacy but were available if we had any questions. They have books and books and books of information about the island. The house is also full of things to use while you’re there (beach chairs, scuba gear, sunscreen etc). They were both so sweet and genuine. Definitely stay here if you have the chance!

Kaeo & Karl were incredible hosts and we LOVED Eco Hale! We were greeted by Kaeo who showed us around and had a delicious light meal prepared for us to enjoy. The hale was very private and we had the best view of the rainforest. It was so peaceful sleeping with the windows open listening to the frogs and rain. There was a gas burner and kettle that I used to make tea and sit on the patio each morning. Kaeo & Karl also have all kinds of equipment, flash lights, and recommendations available for your adventuring. We spent a day and a half at the Hawaii Volcano National Park, which was unbelievable! I would highly recommend going to the park and taking a ranger guided hike so you can get all kinds of recommendations about where to go and how to do it safely. One of the highlights of our trip was taking a bicycle ride and hike to see the active lava flows at dusk. The park is also open 24/7, so you can drive to the Jaggar Museum after dark to see the active gas-eruption at the Halema'uma'u crater.

We are so grateful Kaeo & Karl have opened the Eco Hale to us, and many other travelers! This place was a dream, such a wonderful little home to come back to to after a day of adventuring, and we would love to some day visit again. The details, and thoughtful touches were everywhere and a joy to find. Kaeo & Karl gave us the most thorough driving instructions, and welcomed us with open arms. Everything we could have needed on our stay was provided. Seriously, this hale is cozy, but it really has it all! Everything was perfectly thought out to make sure we weren't wanting for anything and completely comfortable - all the toiletries we could have ever needed were provided along with tons of snacks and home baked goodies to enjoy. The patio is an amazing place to sit with a hot drink and listen to the rain or relax with all the local plant life and at night, the animals of the forest sing you to sleep! Incredible all around!

Well where to begin! The drive up to the Eco Hale is very scenic, you drive past a very lush forest! Kaeo welcomed us with open arms (literally) and made us feel very welcome and at home. The cabin itself is on the smaller side but more than enough for 2 people. It was very clean and it was such great fun exploring the cabin! In every corner and niche there was something to look at or use! Sweats for when it gets cold + some fluffy socks, homemade banana bread and cookies, the fridge was full for breakfast, fresh fruit and a huge folder with activities! This place is absolutely lovely, truly a small gem! If you love peace and quiet this is it for you! If with a partner or friend, it was truly special! A big thank you to Kaeo and Karl for making us feel at home and being the lovely hosts they are!
Mahalo
Annie and Cindy

Kaeo was a great host she thought of everything from warm clothes to raincoats to treats. 

The space is a beautifully designed small cottage in a secluded lush garden.  We were surprised how much it did rain - guess that is why it is so lush

Kano and Karl's place could be difficult to find, but they gave us great directions.  I thought of the Swiss Family Robinson treehouse when I saw their place.  It is in a very lush location complete with tangerine trees which they encourage you to enjoy.  It is very compact, but they have thought of everything.  Lots of thoughtful touches and notes telling us how to do things.  They just installed a japanese bath outside where one can bathe and enjoy the tropical garden.  Kaeo was very helpful when we had a problem connecting to our next airbnb.  I would recommend their place to friends going to the Big Island.  Lovely and peaceful.  Very nice hosts who even made a birthday cake for my husband's 80th birthday!

Fred and Linda

We loved this place, or maybe more accurate-this people. They are really great hosts. They welcomed us with open arms, they prepered a welcome meal. They provided simply everything one could need. They are simply AMAZING! We highly recommend this place.

Decemb (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Jan 1, (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) My husband and I flew into Kona and drove Saddle Road to Eco Hale in the dark after our flight. Kaeo's directions were clear and concise which we greatly appreciated having never been to the Island of Hawaii before. A complementary dinner was provided when we arrive which was homemade and delicious!! Kaeo also made a wonderful banana nut bread for us to enjoy as well! Sweets and treats were provided throughout our stay which helped make us feel welcome and at home. Unlocking/locking the gate to the property was not an inconvenience and helped us feel secure. Eco Hale is beautifully placed in the backyard of Karl and Kaeo's property which allowed for easy communication and quick response to requests. The position and distance between Kaeo and Karl's home from Eco Hale maintained privacy for me and my husband throughout our stay. The bathroom is separate from the bedroom and my husband and I felt comfortable going back and forth in the privacy of Eco Hale. We enjoyed waking up each morning to make French press coffee, hand squeezing fresh orange juice from the juicing oranges on the property, and eating fresh tangerines picked from the trees. The complementary breakfast and stocked mini fridge with juices, yogurt, were a wonderful plus!! Eco Hale is in the rain forrest side of the island which can make nights and mornings chilly in December. Kaeo and Karl provided a few extra sweatpants and blankets hanging up in the closet just incase of colder weather. This closet is filled with useful items! Kaeo and Karl have provided so many items we didn't think we needed. Binoculars, snorkel goggle de-fogger, flashlights, plenty of informational books, beach chairs, beach towels!! The property is gorgeous and filled with all kinds of plants and flowers lining the small trails and garden. The chirps and sounds of the rain forrest nightlife are mesmerizing. Soaking in the OFuro soaking tub was calming and soothing after a day of hiking in HVNP. Kaeo and Karl also encourage recycling and composting, which my husband and I loved!! The 1G wireless was a convenient but also kept cell phone use to minimum. My husband and I wanted a "no-phone-zone" so we used the wireless only to research our activities for the next day. The binder provided by Kaeo and Karl was extremely helpful and filled with information about activities to do in Hawaii, appliance guides, items provided in Eco Hale, and more!! We were off on so many adventures throughout the day that Kaeo provided a basket for us to fill for laundry! This was completely unexpected yet so appreciated!!! From Eco Hale my husband and I achieved so much in 5 days!! HVNP: Thurston Lava Tube, KilaueaIki Crater Trail, Chain of Craters, Holei Sea Arch, Hilo Farmers Market, drive to MaunaLoa (overlook was closed), Snorkeling at Richardson Ocean Park, Kaumana Caves (old lava tube), boogie boarding at the Summit of MaunaKea, eating at Pineapples,Ken's House of...

LOVED this place! The gardens are beautiful and the space felt relaxing, zen, clean, homey. Ww didn’t want to leave. Kaeo has put lots of thoughtful details into the space and it felt private but like we connected with her as well (through notes) :) great communication and wonderful authentic Hawaiian atmosphere. Comfortable bed and tasty fruits and snacks. We will be back one day!

Amazing! :) Don’t hesitate to book here with Kaeo and Karls Eco Hale! We loved feeling like we were in the middle of the jungle, being serenaded at night by the noises of nature. On top of that, the hosts go above and beyond with so many special touches! Couldn’t recommend this place enough!

Three things about Eco Hale made it a most extraordinary, adventurous yet peaceful experience.
First, Mark and Karl have created a unique living space (cottage? Tiki hut...our nickname) that truly immerses you in the Hawaii rainforest. Absolute privacy with only the sights, sounds, feel and smells of the dense growth, birds and occasional rain showers. Nothing better than enjoying a leisurely breakfast of fresh picked frujt, Kaeo's home-baked sweet bread and freshly ground coffee on the open-air bar.  Or capping an action-full day soaking in the Japanese Ofuro tub.
Second, Eco Hale's location is perfect. A short drive from Hilo airport, Hawaii Volcanoes NP and the wild and beautiful Puna coast. In the course of our four days, we experienced:
-- a full day exploring craters, lava flows, lava tubes capped off by a magnificent lava fountain courtesy of Kilauea's lava lake in the evening.
-- dramatic coastal scenes on the island's eastern coast, ranging from desolate to serene
-- active lava closing we witnessed in awe by hiking from Kalapana
-- excellent dining in funky Paula
Third, Kaeo's warm welcome and boundless hospitality is remarkable. Every possible activity, from snorkeling to Bird-watching to hanging at the beach, has been provided for.  She is truly a sweet soul.
Thank you, K&K!
Mark & Sharon

We knew we were going to stay in a rain forest, but the week we were there was abnormally rainy.   Kaeo had suggestions every day for things to do, places to go and where to eat.  We enjoyed everything in spite of the rain.  The coquis sang to us at night, Kaeo came over with freshly baked goods and fruit, the Hale was unique and well decorated with all kinds of fun things.  I would definitely prefer this place to a high rise on the beach.  I can't say enough about the hospitality here.

Staying at Kaeo and Karl's place was a amazing experience. If you're looking to 'get away from it all' in an exotic rain forest setting while still being close to all the attractions of Hilo, Volcano etc. this is the ideal choice. While the accommodation is relatively small it has everything you could need and more. On top of that, there's the little treats that appear now and then (cookies, chocolates, drinks etc.) even though there's a great selection of food waiting for you when you arrive. While Kaeo provides all of the privacy you could want, she also works in the background to ensure your stay is perfect (taking towels away to dry and responding to requests immediately). A couple of tips; the chirping frogs are all part of being in the rain forest but you might want to bring ear plugs if you're a light sleeper and make sure to check out the night sky while you're there, the number of stars you can see is breathtaking!

Eco Hale is a magical little gem hidden away in the rainforest. You hear the sounds of the native birds singing in the trees. You smell the fragrant smells of exotic plants, flowers and fruit trees. It is so very peaceful. A great place to refresh, get the best nights sleep and share a bit of romance with your special person. Kaeo is a warm and inviting hostess who has added so many special touches. Yummy breakfast items, home baked treats and plenty of fresh fruit. The location of Eco Hale is very convenient to all of the adventures awaiting you in the Volcanos area. Our first experience staying at an Airbnb was definitely a 10 out of 10!!

Kaeo and Karl's Eco Hale is hands down my best AirBNB experience to date. They are the most wonderful hosts who have put so much thought into the creation of the ultimate home away from home. The hale was easy to get to thanks to the detailed instructions that were sent to me ahead of time. Kaeo met me as I pulled in, proudly showed me around the hale, and welcomed me to contact her with any questions before she gracefully left me on my own. You do need to un/lock the gate to the drive as you come and go off the property but it is easy peasy. The hale itself is separated from the main house by lush greenery so I enjoyed having a lot of privacy and much-needed quiet. The pupu dinner I'd requested was divine, as were the fruit, cookies, and sweet bread that were also left for me to enjoy. The kitchen was perfectly appointed and I loved being able to cook myself breakfast out on the lanai while brewing coffee in a french press. The east side of the island was chillier than I expected and Kaeo graciously provided me an extra comforter and a cozy sweater to borrow. The bathroom is as adorable as one can be and is right next door to the bedroom, making for a lovely experience of a hybrid indoor/outdoor suite in the middle of the rainforest. My first night I took advantage of the Japanese soaking tub and meditated amid candlelight and the symphony of the coqui frogs. The bed was very comfy and I slept like a baby each night. I absolutely cannot wait to return to the Eco Hale and hopefully, will have more time to chat more with Kaeo, who is a dynamic and loving host. Mahalo nui loa, Kaeo and Karl, and much love to you from Seattle until we meet again!

Super cool eco cottage off the beaten path outside of Volcano National Park.  If you are looking for seclusion, extra special touches to make you feel welcome, and just general relaxation, this is your spot.  Really enjoyed it, and Kaeo was super helpful and responsive.  Would definitely stay again!  Aloha!!

The first thing we wanted to do when we arrived home from Hawaii was write this review for Kaeo and Karl's magical Eco Hale.  


We stayed in many different places throughout Big Island & Maui but we are so grateful that Eco Hale was our first experience with Hawaii.  Kaeo and Karl are right when they say Eco Hale is "True Aloha".  The setting is peaceful, thoughtful and inspiring with it's lush gardens, singing coqui and a house off the grid that feels more luxurious than our house on the east coast :)  But it's Kaeo and Karl's kind and generous spirit that really makes this Air BNB a home.  In all of our years of traveling and staying in various home shares, never have we felt so welcome.  Kaeo and Karl are the true definition of gracious hosts and allowed us to see what the Hawaiian warmth is really about.  We left Eco Hale with a renewed appreciation for the rain forest, for sustainable living and human kind.  Although Kaeo and Karl are very descriptive and clear about Eco Hale, you need to stay there to truly appreciate the beauty of this place.  If we could give Eco Hale 10 stars, we would :)  Thank you, thank you, thank you!

This is one of the best AirBNBs I've ever stayed at. Kaeo has thought of everything you could possibly need, from sunscreen and bugspray to snorkels and a cooler. 
I loved how isolated this place felt, in the middle of a tropical garden with coqui frogs singing. It was very special to have this even after having been at a crowded tourist spot earlier in the day. Definitely my preference over crowded resort spots by a long shot! We are lucky places like this exist, and that people like Kaeo and Karl share them with us. This made our anniversary (and engagement!) very special. I especially loved how they compost, and that everything was off the grid solar! Very cool for these Portland environmentalists.

Literally the only cons I can come up with: there's a lot of moisture (I mean, you're in a rainforest), so towels practically never dried and I woke up feeling damp at night. I don't think there's much to be done about that, just be aware. Also, the toilet paper could've been better. Haha see how trivial those are? Stay here!

Kaeo was so welcoming, and was there to meet us upon arrival. They shared fresh fruit with us from their trees that was delightful to say the least.  Cooking on the patio made me wish I could do it everyday. Huge thanks for sharing this space

5 starts does not do Eco Hale justice. I arrived well into the night and was greeted by Kaeo who gave me a tour of home. Beautiful setting - surrounded by a tropical garden and coqui singing me to sleep. Such attention to detail - including fresh flowers in the AM, sweets and treats in nooks and crannies of the room, and a binder full of ideas/guides/maps for local activities. The Japanese bath was much appreciated after long hikes! As a solo female traveler, I felt very safe and well taken care of. Staying at Eco Hale was an enriching experience in itself. I am looking forward to my next visit :)
Staying here was amazing. The thoughtful touches, yummy food, and amazing local recommendations were spot on. You can’t go wrong staying with Kaeo and Karl!

What a magical place to stay!! It's secluded and surrounded by a wonderful tropical garden!! We were treated to fresh fruit and wonderful treats each day!! Kaeo was ready with suggestions of what to do or where to eat!! We highly recommend you stay here!!!!

This is a magical place.  Imagine sitting on a deck outside, taking a soak while being serenaded by the rainforest frogs.  The eco hale is beautifully decorated with many special touches.  Kaeo makes you feel so treasured!  You should know that the drive into eco hale from the highway is a bit long.  I will definitely recommend it to my friends!

Kaeo & Karl have considered everything. From check in to check out and all points in between, you can be certain they’ve thought of it. 

We came in late at night and while navigating the dark back roads can be a little tricky, their directions have plenty of physical markers to get you there safely. Just be aware, this area is a bit more isolated (about 20m south of Hilo) with spotty cell service, which for us was part of the appeal. But is something to consider when organizing points of interest. 

Even though it’s isolated with tons of flowers, lush trees, and plants, we were PLEASANTLY surprised by the lack of bugs. I mean sure there’s mosquitos and the occasional beetle looking thing but we didn’t see much more then that. And overall build quality is incredible! It was pouring rain a good duration of the time we were there and not a single drop or leak was anywhere to be found. 

Oh and talk about treats and thoughtful touches galore! There was a welcoming meal of lasagna, shrimp Cesar salad, and even a gift since my bday had been a few days prior. 

There’s so much more I’d love to share but it still wouldn’t do Eco Hale justice. This adorable little suite is the perfect jungle paradise with truly welcoming, kind, and generous hosts. We couldn’t have asked for more or better.

This magical rainforest getaway is truly a unique experience, with just enough room for 2 people. We wanted to stay away from urban settings and be immersed in the nature, and this place was the perfect recipe of cozy and comfortable in the most gorgeous setting. You are truly IN the forest so expect a lot of rain, but also surrounded by beautiful flora and fauna. Kaeo was an incredible host and provided tons of fresh fruit + breakfast choices + snacks. My absolute favorite part was the outdoor tub which we used sometimes twice a day, it was sooo relaxing. Overall 5 stars and highly recommended.

Amazing remote spot for any couple looking for an authentic rainforest experience. Fantastic hosts - available when we needed them, gave clear instructions, and left yummy Hawaiian  treats for us!! It was easy so find and the surroundings (and sounds!) are so, so beautiful while very private and romantic. 

Thanks Kaeo and Karl!

Very peaceful, very well set up, and very clean. The jungle sounds helped put you to sleep. A great set up for cooking light meals and making coffee to enjoy on the deck. Many little extras, chocolate, banana bread, fruits and complimentary foods to cook a quick meal.

Kaeo and Karl are incredible hosts. The house is among some gorgeous gardening and it felt like a rainforest. They put special touches into the stay that showed how much they care about their guests. As others have said the banana bread is incredible! Would highly recommend this Eco Hale!

Dear Kaeo and Karl
Thank you for taking such great care for us and making memories to last a lifetime. We were unsure of what to expect but everything in the Eco Hale was way beyond our expectations. We solely booked the place based on recommendations of others on this forum, and would recommend the same of others browsing your field without blinking an eye.

Everything in the house and amenity had a special touch and thought behind it. We were so glad that the kitchen was fully equipped that gave us chance to cook with local ingredients. Your blueberry pie and croissant was simply out of the world! And oh, thanks for sharing the fruits from your backyard. The smoothie we made with it would put Whole Foods to shame. 

Every day, we came back to some or the other item and recommendations with special touch by you.  We could not wait to get up in the morning and experience the early sunshine, do yoga and enjoy freshly brewed coffees. The space was incredibly clean and spacious for our needs. Thanks for sharing your local recommendations that made our trip extremely fruitful.

Saying "thank you" is an understatement for the experience and memories we made. 

Mahalo!
Divya & Warren

Where to start with how amazing the Eco Hale was? Kaeo went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable - and keep us well stocked with homemade snacks. From chocolates in the room to snorkel gear available to coupons and local information about the volcano, we couldn't have been better prepared for a fantastic time. We absolutely loved how remote and secluded the property was, which made taking an outdoor bath a huge treat. 

This was vacation and hospitality at its finest!

We had a wonderful stay at Kaeo and Karl's beautiful Eco Hale in Hawaii. The Hale is surrounded by the most gorgeous plants and we especially loved the sounds of the tree frogs in the evenings. Kaeo and Karl have thought of everything to make your stay extra special. From the yummy treats they leave you to the slippers and cozy blankets, you are truly spoilt in their space. The Hale is very private in its own space tucked away from the main road. 

Additionally, Kaeo is a lovely host and was pure joy to be around. We enjoyed the conversations we had with her while we were there and were impressed with her responsiveness through airbnb before we even arrived. 

I would highly recommend staying at the lovely Eco Hale for your trip to Hawaii. It is a unique experience and one we will remember forever. A huge thanks to Kaeo and Karl for their warm hospitality and unwavering kindness.

The Eco Hale is truly a rainforest paradise, but please keep in mind that this Airbnb is for the outdoorsy type (those who are okay contending with bugs, rain, limited electricity and a long bumpy driveway). To us, these drawbacks were minimal, as the rest of the experience was marvelous.

Kaeo and Karl made sure that we had enough food for breakfast and snacks, and also greeted us with a lovely light meal and bottle of wine. They were both very knowledgeable and helped ease our worries about the recent Kilauea eruption and lava flows. They also have many resources and amenities available for use including, flashlights, binoculars, beach towels, sunscreen, bug spray, slippers, guidebooks/pamphlets. Overall, we could not recommend the Eco Hale enough. 

P.S. Make sure to take advantage of their lovely Japanese soaking tub. It's an incredible experience using it in the evening among the sounds of the rain forest. Enjoy!

What a treat!  Upon arrival we were greated by our fabulous host Kaeo who showed us around and made us feel welcome.  The property is beautiful and very private.  We loved the meal she provided and all the snacks!  Such a lovely space to relax and unplug although you do have wifi if you need it.  They definitely make an effort to address any necessities you may have.  My favorite was the soaking tub!  Thanks for your hospitality and extra aloha Kx2.  
Mahalo,

Danyel and Jonathan

If you have this opportunity, DO IT! You get to live in a rainforest! And there are so many little bonuses in store, and they provide everything you could possibly need. The place is plenty private and they're always available with any questions!

There is literally nothing that I can say that was bad about this place.  This has been my FAVORITE place to stay.  The location is already a beautiful getaway.  Their hospitality went above and beyond my expectations.  They provided us with fresh fruit, delicious snacks and even a small dinner when we first arrived.  Kaeo even remembered that I was lactose intolerant and provided me with oat milk in the fridge.  She was super accommodating when it came to being a later check-in as well.  We went to bed to the sound of tree frogs every night and complete quiet.  The whole area was gorgeous including all the cute decorations around the house.  The shower was hot and they provided shampoo and body wash, which was great!  If we come back to Hawaii, we will absolutely stay here again.  Mahalo!

Wow. What an amazing place. The beautiful jungle garden made it feel like we were the only ones for miles. Kaeo was extremely helpful and shared her knowledge of the area while still allowing us our privacy. She made sure we had the perfect stay!  The poke/salad bowl and other delicious snacks she provided were much appreciated. We highly recommend this place and hope to return one day!

I could say this again and again, from the deepest depths of our hearts, mahalo nui loa. From the moment we met, it felt like being welcomed by “auntie K” rather than just a host. Eco hale and the memories shared will forever hold a special place in our hearts. I could list off all the incredible personal touches and onolicious grinds, but what stands out the most is the love and care that exudes every lush nook and cranny of eco hale. You definitely made our first trip to Hawaii as a couple a memorable one. 
With love and aloha,
Jade & Josh

This is the paradise on earth!
Amazing place and hosts!
We recommend it to everyone who goes to big island!
Mahalo Kaeo and Karl!

Eco Hale was amazing!  My partner and I fell in love with the place immediately.  There’s nothing like being in the middle of a rain forest, with just the sounds of birds, gentle rain, and the otherworldly sounds of coqui frogs chirping at night.  It was so calming, relaxing, soothing.  A switch goes off in your brain when being there. I wanted to spend as much time as possible there just soaking it in.

It’s definitely off the beaten path.  After you leave the main highway, it’s still a long ways in.  But of course this is why it’s so remote and quiet.  We barely noticed the main house where Kaeo and Karl live because the property is so lush.  Kaeo gave us a quick tour and some instructions on how to use the furo, stove, etc. and then left us alone to enjoy our little slice of paradise.  Over the next three days we communicated by text message and handwritten notes, and Kaeo would leave us the most ono (delicious) homemade goodies every day.    This was on top of a well-stocked mini fridge and a full water dispenser, and many other amenities.  Kaeo and Karl thought of everything, and then some.

I am a Hawaii resident and have been to the Big Island dozens of times.  My main advice is, don’t try to see all of Hawaii Island in one trip.  Eco Hale is a great location from which to see the volcano area, the small towns in Puna, Hilo, and on up to the middle of the Hamakua Coast.   We also did Mauna Kea as a day trip (staying until sunset).  The driving distances on the Big Island are so great that you do not want to cram too much into a few days, since you would just spend most of your time driving and not nearly enough time enjoying the island lifestyle.

At Eco Hale the temperature at night was cool, and between the cool air and the coqui frogs, I slept like a baby.  Coqui frogs are controversial in Hawaii.  They were introduced and they spread quickly on Hawaii Island.  Some people are bothered by their chirping, but I’m not one of them.  It just made it feel more like were  in some exotic place in a rainforest.  The feeling reminded me of my travels years ago, when I stayed in off-the-beaten-path places in Bali and Thailand, where the pace of life is so much slower.

In short, this has been our favorite AirBnb!

Kaeo and Karl are top notch hosts!  Expect to be impressed by their hospitality when you stay at Eco Hale.  This tiny living home, off the grid, in a true Hawaiian rainforest is all that it promises!!

There just are not words to describe how incredible Kaeo & Karl's place is! We thoroughly enjoyed every minute we spent there. There are so many small touches that make it feel extra special, and there is nothing that you need that they don't have! We rode out Hurricane Hector's rains and winds that came through but it somehow made their place even more magical. (And they kept us up to date on the current weather and path prediction during the hurricane watch). The rain on the roof and the thunder rumbling in the distance while soaking in the tub waiting for the first frogs to start singing us into the night is one of my favorite memories I have from our Hawaiian Honeymoon. All of the fruits, flowers and baked goods were the most wonderful little surprises. We WILL return once HVNP is reopened (we booked before the eruption) to enjoy some hiking and to be serenaded to sleep by the rain and frogs.

The place is beautifully decorated and I really enjoyed the bird's concerts at night.
I wasn't happy though, that the price shown in the ad was not realiable. In the ad the price was 76 $ and it said that prices vary, so I paid 110 $ for one night. With the description how to get to the place another fee (15% tax on total price) came up that hadn't been mentioned anywhere in the ad (I checked the ad several times). So the price for the room was actually 125 $, which is close to double from advertised. 
It is also very far from Hilo, it takes a 40-min-ride to get there, so I can only recommend it, if you want to enjoy the jungle sounds.

Amazing and cozy space.  A beautiful garden in the back with lots of interesting plants and hideaways to discover. At night frogs serenade you to sleep and the stars are amazing. A bit tucked away from Hilo but is right off the highway that takes your around the island. Highly recommend staying here.
