Amazing eco house! Every detail has been thought out; Karl and Kaeo have done a wonderful job in creating such a warm and welcoming place. Highly recommend staying here, especially if you plan on exploring Hilo.  One of the best air bnbs that I have stayed at.

This was our third time on The Big Island, and we were looking for a new adventure, we had never stayed in the rainforest and eco hale looked like our perfect Tao place.
Our hosts  Kaeo and Karl were awesome. Kaeo greeted us with a Big Aloha and Hug upon arrival. 
Awaiting us in the fridge was a delicious plate filled with abundant shrimp , avocado, coleslaw, fruit and other yummies. Fresh apple bananas as well as papaya was a part of our morning breakfast. There were so many extras provided such as beach chairs, a cooler, snorkeling equipment and even clothing and slippers. The Japanese soaking tub was truly delightful and gazing into the surrounding foliage was mesmerizing. The house was clean and comfy and our hosts were available when needed but respected our privacy. We highly recommend staying at the eco hale for a truly unique experience. Now go book your stay!! With Love, Dave and Susie
Made the beginning of our trip amazing, very much made us feel like we had a home away from home. Would recommend this stay to anyone!

This is an AMAZING space!  It is a true labor of love and you get a real sense of the pride they have for this place.  There were fresh flowers everywhere, BESIDES being in the middle of a rainforest garden!  Kaeo prepared a delicious meal for our first night at their place, asking ahead of time what we like and could or couldn't have.  Her communication with stellar!  The whole place was very quaint and fun.  

The bathroom is not attached to the bedroom, so you have go outside to get to it, but it is three steps away and the place is COMPLETELY ISOLATED and private, so you can move back and forth in your PJs, a towel, or nothing at all without being seen by anyone.  The towels were thick, the bed was comfortable, the space immaculate.  The outdoor area was super inviting.

We didn't use the outdoor tub because we were always gone in the evening during the hours it is able to be used, but I thought it was an incredibly cool option.

The space is near Volcano National Park, not too far from the fabulous Botanical Gardens, and you MUST check out the coffee place a couple miles down the main highway toward Hilo!  The coffee is great and the folks are very nice.  Say "hi" to Destiny for us!  (She is a young women that recognized us when we returned the second day for more coffee.)

We had two concerns; the space was quite small.  We have the type of suitcases that have to be laid flat to find anything and we could not open both suitcases at the same time.  This seemed like a big deal the first day, but we grew used to it.  (There is space outside on the porch for a suitcase, but didn't want to have to do that everyday.)  If you are into little spaces or are flexible, you will think this is a very small deal.  We just got a little claustrophobic about it.

The second thing (and I apologize I didn't say something to Kaeo about this in person) is the shower temperature fluctuates greatly.  I spent more time in the shower waiting for the water to get to a reasonable temperature than I did showering.  (And I'm not too picky about the temperature.

Our stay with Kaeo and Karl was nothing short of magical. The directions that we were provided with were spot on, we were greeted upon arrival and instantly felt welcome. The accommodation itself was completely stunning, perfect rainforest setting. Our lovely hosts respected our privacy while at the same time taking amazing care of us by leaving us notes and treats. The outdoor Japanese soaking tub with the sound of the rain and forest creatures surrounding was the icing on top of the cake. Would recommend this place to anybody who is looking for a trip to remember

Our stay at Eco Hale was magical! Everything we needed in a secluded rainforest cottage. We enjoyed eating papayas on the porch each morning, provided by Kaeo. It was great to have snorkel gear and boogie boards available too!

This place was magical and the little touches and special treats were above and beyond anything we expected. We absolutely loved staying here and loved being on this side of the island. If we ever come back without our children again we will definitely stay here again.

This was the most amazing experience I’ve ever had with an Airbnb superhost. The place is phenomenal and being in the jungle among the beautiful sounds of nature and surrounded by lush green trees and plants was breathtaking. Kaeo & Karl were the most amazing hosts although we didn’t meet Karl. We were greeted by Kaeo at the start of our trip and she was the sweetest person ever. Every evening we came home to treats and notes and a beautiful sanctuary. I highly recommend this location for part if not all of your Hawaii getaway. I will definitely be back and can’t thank Kaeo & Karl enough for opening this place for travelers, vacationer and adventure seekers like ourselves. 
XO
AJ & Alicia.

Unser Aufenthalt bei Kaeo und Karl war einfach perfekt! Wir waren mehr als begeistert, besonders über die liebevollen Details und das tolle gastfreundliche Wesen von Kaeo. Falls jemand plant den Osten oder Süden von Big Island zu erkunden, dann  sollte man definitiv dort übernachten. Wir haben uns sehr, sehr wohl gefühlt. Die besten Gastgeber, die wir/ich bisher erlebt habe!

We perfectely enjoyed our stay at Kaeo's and Karl's place! We were so happy about the lovely details and Kaeo's hospitable character. If somebody plans to visit the East or South of Big Island is this the place to stay at. We felt very, very good there. The best hosts we/I have ever me!

Don't hesitate to stay at this clean, sunny cabin surrounded by nature and teeming with personal touches! We were in awe of the life Kaeo and Karl had made for themselves, and so honored that they would share a bit of it through this eco-friendly space. We looked forward to relaxing there, listening to frogs and drinking chai tea every afternoon. And marveled at the fact that before we knew we needed something (house shoes, sweats, coffee and fresh fruit) it was already in the cabin. Thank you for being amazing hosts!!

Kaeo is the most lovely host with all the nice treats she spoilt us with.
The Eco Hale is very nice, it was just so much driving to get anywhere, we kind of underestimated the distances (so not the hosts fault at all!). For nature-lovers it is just the perfect place to stay and relax.

An amazing hale! We loved the combination of complete privacy and total luxury. The hale is so well designed and provisioned, it is a self-contained space where anyone can find the peace they are looking for. Some of the highlights of our trip were waking up with the sun,  reading in bed, after a long day of adventuring, and (finally) dozing off to the sounds of the coquis.
Mahalo, 
Annie & Henry

Look no further, this is the spot if you want to stay near Hilo. As avid travelers, my wife and I have seen it all and this place takes the cake. Amazing atmosphere, impeccable service, and the perfect combination of privacy and comfort.  Kaeo thinks of everything, and has a massive binder of hot spots and recommendation.  The binder also has a impressive array of history to review and enjoy.  10 out of 10 does not due this place enough justice.  JUST HIT “BOOK NOW” AND SIT BACK AND RELAX.

Great space with great hosts! The space is surrounded by a rain forest garden, complete with flowers and birds everywhere. Highly recommended as a couples retreat as its very private and romantic. Even the bathroom has a great view! We enjoyed using the patio space as our outside living room to enjoy the pupus (appetizer/snacks) provided by the gracious hosts. The space includes everything you could ask for or forgot to pack (snorkel gear, beach items, phone charger, snacks, coffee, the list goes on). We would stay here again in a heartbeat when visiting Volcano National Park and Hilo.

Beautiful place! Kaeo and Karl have created a true oasis in the rainforest. Perfect place to relax and connect with nature, but still not very far to volcanoes national park,  grocery stores,  and dining options. Kaeo and Karl went above and beyond to make sure our experience was perfect, leaving us delicious snacks every day and fresh towels. 100% recommend!

Keao and Karl make it possible to actually live that classic Airbnb dream of “living like a local” - the eco-hale is adjacent to their actual home, both of which are situated in expansive, beautifully curated rainforest grounds. The hospitality they show should also be the gold standard for Airbnb hosts - from cooking us an arrival dinner to surprising us with a Christmas gift on Dec 25, they really care about making their guests feel at home in every way possible. 

My only advice would be to consider before booking if you are comfortable with a certain degree of ruggedness. The fact that this eco-hale is in the rainforest means it’s more often than not heavily raining, and the Airbnb receives a number of insects which are harmless but can be annoying when they swarm around you nonetheless. It’s location is also very remote, which lends to its beauty, but also makes it scary driving home on a road with no lights past sunset. 

That being said, these are only minor comments that I feel should be shared with future guests when booking. We had a great time.

Stay here! We spent our honeymoon at Eco Hale, and it was so peaceful and perfect. Kaeo and Karl have thought of everything you could need or want. We particularly enjoyed the yummy food, soaking tub, and sound of the rainforest at night.

Definitely recommend staying here on your trip to Hawaii! Kaeo was amazingly helpful and kind during our check-in! Eco hale exceeded all our expectations, with lovely and welcoming decorations that capture the spirit of Hawaii and that made you feel right at home. We loved eating breakfast out on the deck, listening to the sounds of the rainforest - there was a kettle for our tea, a stove to make eggs, etc. We loved the little details, from the slippers to the banana bread to the container of quotes and daily reflections. Very close to the Volcanoes National Park and various beaches, which we had a lot of fun exploring.

Kaeo and Karl's place is the perfect little place to get to relax and unwind after a day out and about on the island. Or it's perfect to just spend the day there. They thought of everything and did so much that they didn't need to, I found myself the most impressed with not only how lovely the place is, but the simple touches that they thought of, in order to make absolutely sure that your stay is as close to perfect as possible. I wish it was closer to where I live, because I would go just to stay with them again. Kind hospitality and an adorable little oasis to enjoy the company of a loved one. I cannot give high enough praise to our experience, it was a genuine delight.
A great and funky place to stay. The attention to detail is very good. The home made goodies in the circular tins are epic!

A little bit of paradise! 

Our stay in Kaeo and Karl’s Eco Hale was amazing. Away from the hustle and bustle of the city we found ourselves completely immersed in the beauty of Hawaii. Kaeo greeted us with a warm smile and a hug and made us feel like Ohana from the very beginning. Throughout the entire eco hale were small little touches and amenities that really added to the overall experience. From the fresh fruit and pupus to the home made banana walnut bread. Kaeo and Karl have literally thought of everything. Thank you for making our birthday trip special and we hope to stay with you again on our next trip to the big island!

Lovely little ecolodge in the deep rainforest where you can see the stars and listen to the frogs at night. Adoring spiritual aloha with very thoughtfull personal touch. Lemon- and orange trees, colourfull flowers and lush rainforest will welcome you.

Die Unterkunft liegt abseits der Straße Nr. 11 in einem wunderschönen Regenwald Garten in absolut ruhiger Lage. Die Ausstattung ist einfach, aber sehr originell.
Kaeo hat uns sehr herzlich empfangen. Der Kühlschrank war gefüllt und es gab frisches Obst.
Vielen Dank für alles, wir haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt.
Mahalo
Very nice

name: 3 quartos Península Barra da Tijuca
summary: 111m2. Apto luxo impecável. Aluguel para olimpíadas no condomínio Península na Barra da Tijuca, muito próximo ao centro olímpico. Ar em todos os quartos!  3 Tvs lcds de 32, 42 e 50". Academia com professor, sauna seca e a vapor, piscina, pilattes, futevolei, tenis, pista de corrrida, shopping com restaurantes.

Academia com professor, sauna seca e a vapor, piscina, pilattes, futevolei, tenis, pista de corrrida, shopping com restaurantes.

name: Beautiful Area Single Room
summary: FREE PICK UP TAXI CAR WITH 6 OR MORE DAYS BOOKING!!Best Place of the city in the residencial area of les Corts, just 15 minutes to the city center by metro.  Near University, ESADE, Nou Camp, many shopping near by.
space: Confortable unique apartment near the University and nou camp. Best place to discover the real life in Barcelona. Just 15 minutes to the city center by metro.

Just 15 minutes to the city center by metro.  Wifi free and maps about the city. Free information about how to do and know about Barcelona I will give you many usefull information to enjoy the best of the city. Maps and the best restaurant. Metro Station Les Corts Line 3 walking distance 3 minutes from there city center 15 minutes. Airport by metro and train 40 minutes. I will try to do my best all the time in order to have my guess really happy.
